null.verse 7:195: 他們有腳能行呢？還是有手能擒呢？還是有眼能見呢？還是有耳能聽呢？你說：「你們呼籲你們的配主，然後你們合力來謀害我，你們不用寬恕我。
null.verse 7:196: 我的保佑者確是真主，他降示經典，眷顧善人。
null.verse 7:197: 你們捨他而祈禱的偶像，不能助你們，也不能自助。」
null.verse 7:198: 如果你們叫他們來遵循正道，他們不能聽從你們；你以為他們看著你，其實他們是視而不見的。
null.verse 7:199: 你要原諒，要勸導，要避開愚人。
null.verse 7:200: 如果惡魔慫恿你，你當求庇於真主。他確是全聰的，全知的。
null.verse 7:201: 敬畏者遭遇惡魔蠱惑的時候，能恍然大悟，立刻看見真理。
null.verse 7:202: 惡魔要任隨他的兄弟迷誤，然後他們不肯罷休。
null.verse 7:203: 當你未昭示一種蹟象的時候，他們說：「你怎麼不創造一種呢？」你說：「我只遵守我的主所啟示我的經典，這是為信道的民眾而從你們的主降示的明証和引導和慈恩。」
null.verse 7:204: 當別人誦讀《古蘭經》的時候，你們當側耳細聽，嚴守緘默，以便你們蒙受真主的憐憫。
null.verse 7:205: 你當朝夕恭敬而恐懼地記念你的主，應當低聲讚頌他，你不要疏忽。
null.verse 7:206: 在你的主那裡的（眾天神），不是不屑於崇拜他的，他們讚頌他超絕一切，他們只為他而叩頭。※ 你當朝夕恭敬而恐懼地記念你的主，應當低聲讚頌他，你不要疏忽。

null.verse 7:2: Toto je Písmo, které ti bylo sesláno - nechť není v hrudi tvé ohledně něho obavy žádné abys jím varoval a aby bylo pro věřící připomenutím.
null.verse 7:3: Následujte to, co bylo vám sesláno od Pána vašeho, a nenásledujte jiných pánů vedle Něho! Jak málo si to připomínáte!
null.verse 7:4: Kolik měst jsme již zahubili! Přísnost Naše je zastihla za noci anebo za poledne.
null.verse 7:5: A když postihla je přísnost Naše, zmohli se jedině na zvolání: "Věru jsme byli nespravedliví!"
null.verse 7:6: A zajisté se budeme tázat těch, k nimž poslové byli vysláni, a budeme se ptát i vyslanců Božích,
null.verse 7:7: a věru jim sdělíme se znalostí vše, vždyť My jsme nebyli nepřítomni.
null.verse 7:8: V ten den bude váhou pravda; ti, jichž váha bude obtěžkána dobrými skutky, ti blaženi budou,
null.verse 7:9: zatímco ti, jichž váha bude lehká, sami sobě ztrátu způsobili tím, že nespravedliví k znamením Našim byli.
null.verse 7:10: A umístili jsme vás na zemi a připravili jsme pro vás na ní obživu - a jak málo jste vy vděční!
null.verse 7:11: A vskutku jsme vás stvořili a potom jsme vám podobu dali a posléze jsme k andělům pravili: "Padněte na zem před Adamem!" A padli všichni před ním kromě Iblíse, jenž nebyl mezi těmi, kdož se klaněli.
null.verse 7:12: Pravil Bůh: "Co ti zabránilo, abys padl, když jsem ti to poručil?" Odpověděl: "Já lepší jsem než on, mne z ohně jsi stvořil, jeho však jen z hlíny.
null.verse 7:13: Pravil Bůh: "Sestup odsud, neboť ti nepřísluší, aby ses zde pyšným ukazoval! Odejdi, neboť věru budeš z opovržených!"
null.verse 7:14: Řekl Iblís: "Popřej mi odklad až do dne, kdy budou vzkříšeni!"
null.verse 7:15: Pravil Bůh: "Budiž tedy mezi těmi, jimž odklad je dán!"
null.verse 7:16: Řekl Iblís: "Za to, žes mne odvrhl, budu věru na ně číhat na přímé stezce Tvé
null.verse 7:17: a pak je budu pokoušet zepředu i zezadu, zprava i zleva, takže většinu z nich shledáš nevděčnými!"
null.verse 7:18: Pravil Bůh: "Odejdi odsud zahanben a zavržen! Však těmi, kdož následovat tě budou, já věru peklo naplním všemi!
null.verse 7:19: A ty, Adame, obývej s manželkou svou ráj! Jezte, z čeho se vám zachce, ale nepřibližujte se k tomuto stromu, abyste se nestali nespravedlivými!"
null.verse 7:20: Však satan jim oběma našeptal, aby odhalili to, co dosud před nimi bylo skryto z nahoty jejich, a řekl: "Pán váš zakázal vám tento strom jen proto, abyste se nestali anděly či nesmrtelnými!"
null.verse 7:21: A přísahal jim: "Já vaším rádcem jsem dobrým.
null.verse 7:22: A takto je mámením svým v bloudění zavedl.
null.verse 7:23: Odpověděli: "Pane náš, věru jsme sami sobě ukřivdili; jestliže se nad námi neslituješ a neodpustíš nám, budeme věru z těch, jež ztráta postihla.
null.verse 7:24: Řekl Pán: "Sestupte z ráje! Jedni druhým nepřáteli budete a na zemi bude místo vašeho pobytu a užívání jen na čas určený!"
null.verse 7:25: A pravil dále: "Na ní žít budete a na ní i zemřete a z ní pak budete vyvedeni.
null.verse 7:26: Synové Adamovi, seslali jsme vám již oděvy, které nahotu vaši přikrývají, i ozdoby, avšak oděv bohabojnosti je lepší.
null.verse 7:27: Synové Adamovi! Nechť vás nepokouší satan tak, jako způsobil odchod rodičů vašich z ráje, strhávaje z nich oděv, aby jim ukázal nahotu jejich! A dívá se na vás on i jeho spřeženci z místa, kde je nevidíte.
null.verse 7:28: A když se dopustí necudnosti nějaké, říkají: "Nalezli jsme otce své, že takto činí, a nám tak nařídil Bůh!" Odpověz: "Bůh nikdy nepřikazuje necudnosti! Chcete snad mluvit o Bohu něco, co vůbec neznáte?"
null.verse 7:29: Rci: "Pán můj spravedlnost přikazuje! Obracejte k Němu tváře své u modlitebny každé a vzývejte Jej, upřímně mu zasvěcujíce svou víru! A jak vás stvořil poprvé, tak se k Němu i navrátíte.
null.verse 7:30: Jednu skupinu On správnou cestou vede, zatímco druhou odsoudil k bloudění, takže si vzali místo Boha za přátele satany, a přitom si myslí, že po správné cestě jsou vedeni.
null.verse 7:31: Synové Adamovi! Odívejte se do šatů ozdobných v modlitebně každé! Jezte a pijte, avšak nepřehánějte, vždyť On nemiluje ty, kdož přehánějí!.
null.verse 7:32: Rci: "Kdo zakázal šaty ozdobné, jež Bůh seslal služebníkům Svým podobně jako výtečné věci pro obživu?" Odpověz: "Toto je dáno na dobu života pozemského těm, kdož uvěřili, a bude to pro ně čisté v den zmrtvýchvstání.
null.verse 7:33: Rci: Pán můj věru zakázal jen necudnosti veřejné i tajné, hřích a bezprávnou svévoli; a dále, abyste přidružovali k Bohu to, k čemu On neseslal oprávnění, a mluvili o Bohu to, o čem nemáte ponětí.
null.verse 7:34: A každý národ má svou lhůtu danou, a když se lhůta jeho dovrší, nemůže ji odložit ani uspíšit ni o hodinu jedinou.
null.verse 7:35: Synové Adamovi! Věru k vám přijdou poslové z vašich řad vzešlí, aby vám sdělili Má znamení.
null.verse 7:36: Avšak ti, kdož Má znamení za lež prohlašovali a s pýchou se od nich odvraceli, ti budou ohně obyvateli a v něm zůstanou nesmrtelní.
null.verse 7:37: A kdo je nespravedlivější než ten, kdo o Bohu si lži vymyslil či znamení Jeho za lež prohlásil? Takovým dostane se podílu jejich podle toho, co v Knize je napsáno.
null.verse 7:38: A řekne Bůh:,, Vstupte do ohně mezi národy z džinů a lidí, které již zmizely před vámi!" A kdykoliv vstoupí do něho národ některý, proklínat bude sobě podobné, a až nakonec se v něm octnou všechny vespolek, tu poslední řeknou o prvních: "Pane náš, tihle nás z cesty svedli, vyměř jim trest ohně dvojnásobný!" A odpoví; "Všem dostane se dvojnásobku, avšak vy to ještě nevíte.
null.verse 7:39: A řeknou národy první posledním: "Nepatří vám, abyste měly přednost nějakou před námi, okuste tedy trest za to, co jste si vysloužily!"
null.verse 7:40: Věru těm, kdož znamení Naše za lživá prohlašovali a pyšně se od nich odvraceli, nebudou otevřeny nebes brány a oni nevstoupí do ráje, dokud neprojde velbloud uchem jehly.
null.verse 7:41: Pro ně budou v pekle lůžka připravena a na nich pokrývky ohnivé - a takto My odměňujeme nespravedlivé!
null.verse 7:42: Avšak ti, kdož uvěřili a dobré skutky konali a My duši každé ukládáme jen to, nač stačí, ti budou ráje obyvateli a v něm budou nesmrtelní.
null.verse 7:43: A vyjmeme z hrudí jejich nenávist veškerou a pod nimi řeky potekou - a budou říkat: "Chvála Bohu, jenž nás sem uvedl! My sami bychom nebyli nalezli správnou cestu, kdyby nás Bůh nebyl na ni zavedl; a přinesli nám poslové Pána našeho pravdu.

null.verse 7:81: "Gij nadert met wellust mannen, in plaats van vrouwen.
null.verse 7:82: Het antwoord van zijn volk was slechts: "Verdrijft hen uit uw stad, want zij zijn mannen die zich rein willen houden.
null.verse 7:83: Wij redden hem en zijn familie, met uitzondering van zijn vrouw, zij behoorde tot de achterblijvenden.
null.verse 7:84: En Wij deden een regen van stenen over hen komen.
null.verse 7:85: En tot Midian hun broeder Shoaib.
null.verse 7:86: "En wacht niet op de wegen om degenen die in Hem geloven te bedreigen en van het pad van God af te houden en het oneffen te maken.

null.verse 7:88: De leidende mannen van zijn volk die aanmatigend waren, antwoordden: "Wij zullen u, o Shoaib, en de gelovigen met u zeker uit onze stad verdrijven tenzij gij tot onze godsdienst terugkeert.
null.verse 7:89: En indien wij tot uw godsdienst terugvallen, nadat God ons er van heeft gered, dan hebben wij voorzeker een leugen aangaande God verzonnen.

null.verse 7:94: En Wij zonden nimmer een profeet naar een stad zonder dat Wij het volk er van met tegenspoed en lijden troffen, opdat zij zouden verootmoedigen.
null.verse 7:95: Daarna verwisselden Wij het boze met het goede, totdat zij groeiden en zeiden: "Lijden en geluk wedervoeren onze vaderen ook.
null.verse 7:96: En indien de mensen van die steden hadden geloofd en rechtvaardig waren geweest, zouden Wij zeker zegeningen van de hemel en van de aarde voor hen hebben gezonden, maar zij verloochenden (onze profeet); daarom grepen Wij hen vanwege hun daden.
null.verse 7:97: Zijn de bewoners der steden veilig voor de komst van Onze straf over hen, ’s nachts, terwijl zij slapen?
null.verse 7:98: Of zijn de bewoners dezer steden veilig voor Onze straf die over hen zou kunnen komen, des daags terwijl zij zich vermaken?
null.verse 7:99: Zijn zij dan veilig voor God’s voornemen? En niemand waant zich veilig voor God’s voornemen, dan het volk dat te gronde gaat.
null.verse 7:100: Doet het degenen, die de aarde beerven na haar (vroegere) bewoners niet inzien, dat, indien Wij het willen, Wij hen om hun zonden treffen en hun hart verzegelen, zodat zij niet meer horen?
null.verse 7:101: Zo waren de steden wier verhaal Wij u hebben verteld.
null.verse 7:102: Wij vonden in de meesten hunner geen (trouw aan het) verbond en Wij bevonden dat de meesten hunner overtreders waren.
null.verse 7:103: Toen zonden Wij na hen (de vorige boodschappers) Mozes met Onze tekenen naar Pharao en zijn leiders, maar zij geloofden er niet in.
null.verse 7:104: En Mozes zeide: "O, Pharao, ik ben waarlijk een boodschapper van de Heer der Werelden.
null.verse 7:105: "Ik mag slechts de waarheid over God spreken.
null.verse 7:106: Hij antwoordde: "Als gij inderdaad met een teken zijt gekomen breng het naar voren als gij tot de waarachtigen behoort.
null.verse 7:107: Hij (Mozes) wierp zijn stok neer en ziet, het was duidelijk een slang.
null.verse 7:108: En hij haalde zijn hand tevoorschijn en ziet, zij was wit (geworden) voor de toeschouwers.
null.verse 7:109: De leiders van het volk van Pharao zeiden: "Dit is gewis een vaardige tovenaar.
null.verse 7:110: "Hij wil u uit uw land zetten.
null.verse 7:111: Zij zeiden: "Geef hem en zijn broeder tijd en zend (intussen) omroepers de steden in,
null.verse 7:112: Die elke vaardige tovenaar tot u zullen brengen.
null.verse 7:113: En de tovenaars kwamen tot Pharao en zeiden: "Wij zullen natuurlijk als wij de overhand krijgen een beloning ontvangen.
null.verse 7:114: Hij (Pharao) antwoordde: "Ja en gij zult tot de gunstelingen behoren.
null.verse 7:115: Zij zeiden: "O Mozes zul jij of zullen wij het eerst werpen?"
null.verse 7:116: Hij antwoordde: "Werp jij.
null.verse 7:117: En Wij bezielden Mozes en zeiden: "Werp uw stok neer" en ziet, deze slokte al hetgeen zij getoverd hadden op.
null.verse 7:118: Zo werd de waarheid bevestigd en bleek wat zij deden ijdel te zijn.
null.verse 7:119: Zo werden zij verslagen en vernederd.
null.verse 7:120: En de tovenaars werden bewogen zich neer te werpen.
null.verse 7:121: En zeiden: "Wij geloven in de Heer der Werelden.
null.verse 7:123: Pharao zeide: "Heb je vóór ik het u toestond in Hem geloofd? Dit is voorzeker een complot dat gij in de stad hebt gesmeed, opdat gij haar bewoners er uit moogt verdrijven maar gij zult het weldra te weten komen.
null.verse 7:124: "Ik zal gewis uw handen en uw voeten aan tegengestelde zijden (rechts en links) doen afsnijden.
null.verse 7:125: Zij antwoordden: "Wij zullen voorzeker naar onze Heer terugkeren.
null.verse 7:126: En gij neemt alleen wraak op ons omdat wij in de tekenen van onze Heer hebben geloofd toen zij ons getoond werden.
null.verse 7:127: En de leiders van het volk van Pharao zeiden: "Wil je Mozes en zijn volk in het land wanorde laten scheppen en u en uw goden laten verzaken?" Hij antwoordde: "Wij zullen hun zonen doden en hun vrouwen sparen.
null.verse 7:128: Mozes zeide tot zijn volk: "Zoekt de hulp van God en weest geduldig.
null.verse 7:129: Zij antwoordden: "Wij werden vervolgd, voordat gij tot ons kwaamt en nadat gij tot ons zijt gekomen.
null.verse 7:130: En Wij straften het volk van Pharao door droogte en met schaarste van vruchten, opdat zij er lering uit mochten trekken.
null.verse 7:131: Wanneer er goeds tot hen kwam zeiden zij: "Dit komt ons toe.
null.verse 7:132: En zij zeiden (tot Mozes): "Welk teken gij ons ook moogt brengen om er ons mede te betoveren, wij zullen stellig niet in u geloven.
null.verse 7:133: Toen zonden Wij de storm en de sprinkhanen en de luizen en de kikvorsen en bloed over hen - als duidelijke tekenen, doch zij gedroegen zich hoogmoedig en waren een schuldig volk.
null.verse 7:134: En toen de straf op hen viel, zeiden zij: "O, Mozes, bid voor ons tot uw Heer, zoals Hij u heeft beloofd.
null.verse 7:135: Maar toen Wij de straf van hen verwijderden voor een bepaalde termijn, die zij moesten voleindigen, ziet, toen braken zij (hun beloften.
null.verse 7:136: Wij straften hen derhalve en verdronken hen in zee, omdat zij Onze tekenen verloochenden en er geen acht op sloegen.
null.verse 7:137: En Wij deden de mensen die voor zwak werden gehouden de oostelijke en westelijke gedeelten van het land, welke Wij zegenden, erven.
null.verse 7:138: En Wij deden de kinderen Israëls door de zee trekken en zij kwamen tot een volk dat aan zijn afgoden was gehecht.
null.verse 7:139: "Wat dezen betreft, al hetgeen waarmede zij zich bezig houden, zal worden vernietigd en al hetgeen zij doen zal vergeefs zijn.
null.verse 7:140: Hij zeide (verder): "Zal ik u een andere god dan God zoeken, terwijl Hij u boven de volkeren heeft verheven?"
null.verse 7:141: Toen Wij u van Pharao’s volk verlosten dat u aan een marteling onderwierp en uw zonen doodde en uw vrouwen spaarde.
null.verse 7:142: En Wij maakten met Mozes een overeenkomst van dertig nachten en vulden ze met tien nachten aan.
null.verse 7:143: En toen Mozes op Onze vastgestelde tijd kwam en zijn Heer tot hem sprak, zeide hij: "Mijn Heer, toon U aan mij, opdat ik U moge aanschouwen.
null.verse 7:144: God zeide: "O, Mozes, Ik heb u door Mijn boodschappen en Mijn woord boven de volkeren uitverkoren.
null.verse 7:145: En Wij schreven op de tafelen allerhande raad en uitleg voor alles.
null.verse 7:146: Ik zal voorzeker degenen, die ten onrechte trots handelen op aarde weldra van Mijn tekenen afkeren; en hoewel zij alle tekenen zien, zullen zij er niet in geloven, en als zij het pad der rechtvaardigheid zien zullen zij dit als weg niet aanvaarden, maar indien zij het pad der dwaling zien, zullen zij deze als weg wel inslaan.
null.verse 7:147: En zij, die Onze tekenen en de laatste Ontmoeting verloochenen - hun werken zullen verloren gaan.
null.verse 7:148: En het volk van Mozes maakte van hun sieraden in zijn afwezigheid het lichaam van een kalf - dat een loeiende toon voortbracht.
null.verse 7:149: Toen zij wroeging gevoelden en zagen, dat zij inderdaad gedwaald hadden, zeiden zij: "Als onze Heer ons geen barmhartigheid betoont en ons vergeeft, zullen wij gewis tot de verliezers behoren.
null.verse 7:150: En toen Mozes verontwaardigd en bedroefd tot zijn volk terugkeerde, zeide hij: "Hetgeen gij in mijn afwezigheid deedt, was slecht.
null.verse 7:151: Hij (Mozes) zeide: "Mijn Heer, vergeef mij en mijn broeder en laat ons tot Uw barmhartigheid toe want U bent de Allergenadigste.
null.verse 7:152: Voorzeker, degenen die het kalf aanbaden zal de toorn van hun Heer en de vernedering in het tegenwoordig leven treffen En zo bejegenen Wij degenen, die een leugen verzinnen.
null.verse 7:153: Doch diegenen die kwaad doen en daarna berouw tonen en geloven, voorzeker uw Heer is dan Vergevensgezind, Genadevol.
null.verse 7:154: Toen Mozes’ toorn was gekalmeerd, nam hij de tafelen en er was leiding en barmhartigheid in het geschrift voor degenen, die hun Heer vrezen.
null.verse 7:155: En Mozes koos voor Onze ontmoeting zeventig mannen van zijn volk.
null.verse 7:156: "En verorden het goede voor ons in deze wereld en in het Hiernamaals; wij zijn tot U gekomen.
null.verse 7:157: "Hun, die de boodschapper, de reine profeet volgen, die zij in de Torah en het Evangelie beschreven vinden, legt hij het goede op en verbiedt het kwade, veroortooft hun de goede dingen en verbiedt de slechte en ontheft hen van de last en de kluisters die hen bonden.
null.verse 7:158: Zeg: "O mensdom, ik ben u allen tot een boodschapper van God, aan Wie het koninkrijk der hemelen en der aarde behoort.
null.verse 7:159: Er is een deel van het volk van Mozes dat tot waarheid aanspoort en daarmede rechtvaardig handelt.
null.verse 7:160: En Wij verdeelden hen in twaalf stammen, als afzonderlijke volkeren.
null.verse 7:161: En toen er tot hen werd gezegd: "Woont in deze stad en eet ervan waar gij ook wilt en zegt: ’God, verlicht onze last’, en gaat de poort in nederigheid binnen, Wij zullen u uw tekortkomingen vergeven.
null.verse 7:162: Maar de onrechtvaardigen onder hen vervingen het woord door een ander dat niet tot hen was gesproken.
null.verse 7:163: En vraag hun omtrent de stad, die aan de zee lag.
null.verse 7:164: Toen een gedeelte hunner zeide: "Waarom predik je tot een volk dat God wil vernietigen of met een strenge kastijding gaat straffen?" Het andere deel antwoordde: "Als een verontschuldiging tegenover uw Heer en opdat zij rechtvaardig mogen worden.
null.verse 7:165: En toen zij de vermaning vergaten redden Wij degenen die het kwade verboden en grepen de onrechtvaardigen met een strenge straf aan, omdat zij verkeerd handelden.
null.verse 7:166: En toen zij overtraden, hetgeen hun was verboden, zeiden Wij tot hen: "Weest verachte apen.
null.verse 7:167: En toen verkondigde uw Heer dat Hij dezulken zou zenden, die hen (de Joden) met een marteling zouden kwellen tot de dag der Opstanding.
null.verse 7:168: En Wij verdeelden hen in groepen over de aarde.
null.verse 7:169: Na hen kwam er een boos geslacht dat het Boek erfde.
null.verse 7:170: En die zich aan het Boek vasthouden en in het gebed volhardend zijn - voorzeker Wij doen de beloning der goeden niet verloren gaan.
null.verse 7:171: Toen Wij de berg (Sinaï) boven hen deden schudden alsof hij een losse bedekking was, dachten zij, dat deze op hen zou vallen; Wij zeiden: "Houdt u aan hetgeen Wij u hebben gegeven vast en gedenkt wat er in staat, opdat gij moogt worden behouden.
null.verse 7:172: En toen uw Heer van Adams kinderen een nageslacht uit hun lendenen voortbracht, en hen deed getuigen over henzelf: "Ben ik uw Heer niet?" antwoordden zij: "Ja, wij getuigen" zodat gij op de Dag der Opstanding niet zoudt zeggen: "Wij waren ons hiervan zeker niet bewust.
null.verse 7:173: Of gij zolldt zeggen: "Het waren alleen onze vaderen die afgoderij bedreven en wij waren een geslacht na hen.
null.verse 7:174: En zo verklaren Wij de tekenen opdat zij zich mogen bekeren.
null.verse 7:175: En vertel hun het verhaal van de man die Wij Onze tekenen gaven, maar hij wendde zich af, daarom volgde Satan hem en hij werd verleid.
null.verse 7:176: En indien Wij wilden, konden Wij hem er door verheffen doch hij verkoos de aarde en volgde zijn begeerten, hij is als een hond: als gij hem achtervolgt laat deze zijn tong (uit de bek) hangen en indien gij hem met rust laat steekt hij ook zijn tong uit.
null.verse 7:177: Slecht is de toestand van een volk dat Onze tekenen verloochent, het handelt onjuist tegen zichzelf.
null.verse 7:178: Wie God leidt is op het rechte pad.
null.verse 7:179: Voorwaar, Wij hebben menige djinn en mens geschapen wier einde de hel zal zijn.
null.verse 7:180: Aan God behoren alle goede eigenschappen.
null.verse 7:181: En er is onder hen die Wij hebben geschapen een volk, dat de mensen met waarheid leidt en rechtvaardig oordeelt.
null.verse 7:182: En degenen, die Onze tekenen verwerpen zullen Wij geleidelijk aangrijpen, op een wijze die zij niet verwachten.
null.verse 7:183: Ik geef hun uitstel.
null.verse 7:184: Hebben zij er niet over nagedacht dat er in hun metgezel (Mohammed) geen krankzinnigheid is? Hij is slechts een duidelijk waarschuwer.
null.verse 7:185: Hebben zij het koninkrijk der hemelen en der aarde en alle dingen die God geschapen heeft, niet bekeken? En dat hun termijn waarschijnlijk reeds naderbij is gekomen? In welk woord zullen zij dan daarna geloven?
null.verse 7:186: En wie God laat dwalen, voor hem kan er geen gids zijn.
null.verse 7:187: Vragen zij u omtrent het uur, wanneer het zal plaatsvinden? Zeg: "De kennis daarvan is slechts bij mijn Heer.
null.verse 7:188: Zeg: "Ik heb buiten hetgeen God wil, geen macht over goed of kwaad voor mijzelf.
null.verse 7:189: Hij is het, Die u uit een enkele ziel heeft geschapen en daaruit haar gade maakte, opdat deze troost in haar mocht vinden.
null.verse 7:190: Maar als Hij hun een welgeschapen kind geeft, schrijven zij deelgenoten aan Hem toe, betreffende hetgeen Hij hun beiden heeft gegeven.
null.verse 7:191: Vereenzelvigen zij met God degenen die niets scheppen terwijl deze zelf geschapen zijn?
null.verse 7:192: En zij kunnen anderen geen hulp verlenen noch kunnen zij zichzelf helpen.
null.verse 7:193: En als gij hen tot leiding roept zullen zij u niet volgen.
null.verse 7:194: Voorwaar, degenen die gij naast God aanroept zijn dienaren, zoals gij.
null.verse 7:195: Hebben zij voeten waarmee zij lopen of hebben zij handen waarmee zij vasthouden, of hebben zij ogen waarmee zij zien of hebben zij oren waarmee zij horen? Zeg: "Roept de deelgenoten aan.
null.verse 7:196: Waarlijk, mijn Beschermer is alleen God Die het Boek (de Koran) heeft geopenbaard.
null.verse 7:197: En zij, die gij naast Hem aanroept hebben geen macht om u te helpen noch kunnen zij zichzelf helpen.
null.verse 7:198: En als gij hen tot leiding uitnodigt horen zij u niet.
null.verse 7:199: Neig u tot vergiffenis en spoor tot vriendelijkheid aan en wend u van de onwetenden af.
null.verse 7:200: En als een boze ingeving van Satan u (tot het kwade) aanspoort, zoek dan uw toevlucht bij God; voorzeker, Hij is Alhorend, Alwetend.
null.verse 7:201: Degenen die (God) vrezen, wanneer hen een boze neiging van Satan overvalt, gedenken God en ziet, zij zijn ziende.
null.verse 7:202: En hun broederen trachten hen te doen toenemen in dwaling, doch zij falen niet.
null.verse 7:203: En wanneer gij hun geen teken brengt, zeggen zij: "Waarom verzin je het niet? " Antwoord: "Ik volg alleen hetgeen mij van mijn Heer wordt geopenbaard.
null.verse 7:204: En wanneer de Koran wordt voorgedragen, luistert er naar en weest stil, opdat u barmhartigheid moge geschieden.
null.verse 7:205: En gedenk uw Heer, ’s morgens en ’s avonds in uw gedachte met nederigheid en vrees en zonder luidruchtigheid van spraak en behoor niet tot de onachtzamen.
null.verse 7:206: Waarlijk, degenen die dicht bij uw Heer zijn wenden zich niet met trots van Zijn aanbidding af doch zij verheerlijken Hem en werpen zich voor Hem neer.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:2: (It is) a Scripture that is revealed unto thee (Muhammad) - so let there be no heaviness in thy heart therefrom - that thou mayst warn thereby, and (it is) a Reminder unto believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:3: (Saying): Follow that which is sent down unto you from your Lord, and follow no protecting friends beside Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:4: How many a township have We destroyed! As a raid by night, or while they slept at noon, Our terror came unto them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:5: No plea had they, when Our terror came unto them, save that they said: Lo! We were wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:6: Then verily We shall question those unto whom (Our message) hath been sent, and verily We shall question the messengers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:7: Then verily We shall narrate unto them (the event) with knowledge, for We were not absent (when it came to pass).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:8: The weighing on that day is the true (weighing).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:9: And as for those whose scale is light: those are they who lose their souls because they used to wrong Our revelations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:10: And We have given you (mankind) power in the earth, and appointed for you therein livelihoods.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:11: And We created you, then fashioned you, then told the angels: Fall ye prostrate before Adam! And they fell prostrate, all save Iblis, who was not of those who make prostration.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:12: He said: What hindered thee that thou didst not fall prostrate when I bade thee ? (Iblis) said: I am better than him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:13: He said: Then go down hence! It is not for thee to show pride here, so go forth! Lo! thou art of those degraded.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:14: He said: Reprieve me till the day when they are raised (from the dead).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:15: He said: Lo! thou art of those reprieved.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:16: He said: Now, because Thou hast sent me astray, verily I shall lurk in ambush for them on Thy Right Path.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:17: Then I shall come upon them from before them and from behind them and from their right hands and from their left hands, and Thou wilt not find most of them beholden (unto Thee).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:18: He said: Go forth from hence, degraded, banished.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:19: And (unto man): O Adam! Dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden and eat from whence ye will, but come not nigh this tree lest ye become wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:20: Then Satan whispered to them that he might manifest unto them that which was hidden from them of their shame, and he said: Your Lord forbade you from this tree only lest ye should become angels or become of the immortals.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:21: And he swore unto them (saying): Lo! I am a sincere adviser unto you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:22: Thus did he lead them on with guile.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:23: They said: Our Lord! We have wronged ourselves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:24: He said: Go down (from hence), one of you a foe unto the other.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:25: He said: There shall ye live, and there shall ye die, and thence shall ye be brought forth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:26: O Children of Adam! We have revealed unto you raiment to conceal your shame, and splendid vesture, but the raiment of restraint from evil, that is best.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:27: O Children of Adam! Let not Satan seduce you as he caused your (first) parents to go forth from the Garden and tore off from them their robe (of innocence) that he might manifest their shame to them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:28: And when they do some lewdness they say: We found our fathers doing it and Allah hath enjoined it on us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:30: A party hath He led aright, while error hath just hold over (another) party, for lo! they choose the devils for protecting supporters instead of Allah and deem that they are rightly guided.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:31: O Children of Adam! Look to your adornment at every place of worship, and eat and drink, but be not prodigal.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:32: Say: Who hath forbidden the adornment of Allah which He hath brought forth for His bondmen, and the good things of His providing ? Say: Such, on the Day of Resurrection, will be only for those who believed during the life of the world.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:33: Say: My Lord forbiddeth only indecencies, such of them as are apparent and such as are within, and sin and wrongful oppression, and that ye associate with Allah that for which no warrant hath been revealed, and that ye tell concerning Allah that which ye know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:34: And every nation hath its term, and when its term cometh, they cannot put it off an hour nor yet advance (it).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:35: O Children of Adam! When messengers of your own come unto you who narrate unto you My revelations, then whosoever refraineth from evil and amendeth - there shall no fear come upon them neither shall they grieve.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:36: But they who deny Our revelations and scorn them - each are rightful owners of the Fire; they will abide therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:37: Who doeth greater wrong than he who inventeth a lie concerning Allah or denieth Our tokens.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:38: He saith: Enter into the Fire among nations of the jinn and humankind who passed away before you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:39: And the first of them saith unto the last of them: Ye were no whit better than us, so taste the doom for what ye used to earn.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:40: Lo! they who deny Our revelations and scorn them, for them the gates of heaven will nor be opened not will they enter the Garden until the camel goeth through the needle’s eye.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:41: Theirs will be a bed of hell, and over them coverings (of hell).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:42: But (as for) those who believe and do good works - We tax not any soul beyond its scope - Such are rightful owners of the Garden.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:43: And We remove whatever rancour may be in their hearts.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:44: And the dwellers of the Garden cry unto the dwellers of the Fire: We have found that which our Lord promised us (to be) the Truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:45: Who debar (men) from the path of Allah and would have it crooked, and who are disbelievers in the Last Day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:47: And when their eyes are turned toward the dwellers of the Fire, they say: Our Lord! Place us not with the wrong-doing folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:48: And the dwellers on the Heights call unto men whom they know by their marks, (saying): What did your multitude and that in which ye took your pride avail you ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:49: Are these they of whom ye swore that Allah would not show them mercy ? (Unto them it hath been said): Enter the Garden.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:50: And the dwellers of the Fire cry out unto the dwellers of the Garden: Pour on us some water or some wherewith Allah hath provided you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:51: Who took their religion for a sport and pastime, and whom the life of the world beguiled.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:52: Verily We have brought them a Scripture which We expounded with knowledge, a guidance and a mercy for a people who believe.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:53: Await they aught save the fulfilment thereof ? On the day when the fulfilment thereof cometh, those who were before forgetful thereof will say: The messengers of our Lord did bring the Truth! Have we any intercessors, that they may intercede for us ? Or can we be returned (to life on earth), that we may act otherwise than we used to act ? They have lost their souls, and that which they devised hath failed them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:54: Lo! your Lord is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days, then mounted He the Throne.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:55: (O mankind!) Call upon your Lord humbly and in secret.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:56: Work not confusion in the earth after the fair ordering (thereof).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:57: And He it is Who sendeth the winds as tidings heralding His mercy, till, when they bear a cloud heavy (with rain), We lead it to a dead land, and then cause water to descend thereon and thereby bring forth fruits of every kind.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:58: As for the good land, its vegetation cometh forth by permission of its Lord; while as for that which is bad, only the useless cometh forth (from it).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:59: We sent Noah (of old) unto his people, and he said: O my people! Serve Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:60: The chieftains of his people said: Lo! we see thee surely in plain error.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:61: He said: O my people! There is no error in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:62: I convey unto you the messages of my Lord and give good counsel unto you, and know from Allah that which ye know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:63: Marvel ye that there should come unto you a Reminder from your Lord by means of a man among you, that he may warn you, and that ye may keep from evil, and that haply ye may find mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:64: But they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ship, and We drowned those who denied Our tokens.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:65: And unto (the tribe of) A’ad (We sent) their brother, Hud.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:66: The chieftains of his people, who were disbelieving, said: Lo! we surely see thee in foolishness, and lo! we deem thee of the liars.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:67: He said: O my people! There is no foolishness in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:68: I convey unto you the messages of my Lord and am for you a true adviser.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:69: Marvel ye that there should come unto you a Reminder from your Lord by means of a man among you, that he may warn you ? Remember how He made you viceroys after Noah’s folk, and gave you growth of stature.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:70: They said: Hast come unto us that we should serve Allah alone, and forsake what our fathers worshipped ? Then bring upon us that wherewith thou threatenest us if thou art of the truthful!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:71: He said: Terror and wrath from your Lord have already fallen on you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:72: And We saved him and those with him by a mercy from Us, and We cut the root of those who denied Our revelations and were not believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:73: And to (the tribe of) Thamud (We sent) their brother Salih.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:74: And remember how He made you viceroys after A’ad and gave you station in the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:75: The chieftains of his people, who were scornful, said unto those whom they despised, unto such of them as believed: Know ye that Salih is one sent from his Lord ? They said: Lo! In that wherewith he hath been sent we are believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:76: Those who were scornful said: Lo! in that which ye believe we are disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:77: So they hamstrung the she-camel, and they flouted the commandment of their Lord, and they said: O Salih! Bring upon us that thou threatenest if thou art indeed of those sent (from Allah).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:78: So the earthquake seized them, and morning found them prostrate in their dwelling-place.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:79: And (Salih) turned from them and said: O my people! I delivered my Lord’s message unto you and gave you good advice, but ye love not good advisers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:80: And Lot! (Remember) when he said unto his folk: Will ye commit abomination such as no creature ever did before you ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:81: Lo! ye come with lust unto men instead of women.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:82: And the answer of his people was only that they said (one to another): Turn them out of your township.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:83: And We rescued him and his household, save his wife, who was of those who stayed behind.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:84: And We rained a rain upon them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:85: And unto Midian (We sent) their brother, Shu’eyb.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:86: Lurk not on every road to threaten (wayfarers), and to turn away from Allah’s path him who believeth in Him, and to seek to make it crooked.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:87: And if there is a party of you which believeth in that wherewith I have been sent, and there is a party which believeth not, then have patience until Allah judge between us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:88: The chieftains of his people, who were scornful, said: Surely we will drive thee out, O Shu’eyb, and those who believe with thee, from our township, unless ye return to our religion.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:89: We should have invented a lie against Allah if we returned to your religion after Allah hath rescued us from it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:90: But the chieftains of his people, who were disbelieving, said: If ye follow Shu’eyb, then truly ye shall be the losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:91: So the earthquake seized them and morning found them prostrate in their dwelling-place.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:92: Those who denied Shu’eyb became as though they had not dwelt there.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:93: So he turned from them and said: O my people! I delivered my Lord’s messages unto you and gave you good advice; then how can I sorrow for a people that rejected (truth) ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:94: And We sent no prophet unto any township but We did afflict its folk with tribulation and adversity that haply they might grow humble.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:95: Then changed We the evil plight for good till they grew affluent and said: Tribulation and distress did touch our fathers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:96: And if the people of the townships had believed and kept from evil, surely We should have opened for them blessings from the sky and from the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:97: Are the people of the townships then secure from the coming of Our wrath upon them as a night-raid while they sleep ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:98: Or are the people of the townships then secure from the coming of Our wrath upon them in the daytime while they play ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:99: Are they then secure from Allah’s scheme ? None deemeth himself secure from Allah’s scheme save folk that perish.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:100: Is it not an indication to those who inherit the land after its people (who thus reaped the consequence of evil-doing) that, if We will, We can smite them for their sins and print upon their hearts so that they hear not ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:102: We found no (loyalty to any) covenant in most of them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:103: Then, after them, We sent Moses with our tokens unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they repelled them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:104: Moses said: O Pharaoh! Lo! I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:105: Approved upon condition that I speak concerning Allah nothing but the truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:106: (Pharaoh) said: If thou comest with a token, then produce it, if thou art of those who speak the truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:107: Then he flung down his staff and lo! it was a serpent manifest;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:108: And he drew forth his hand (from his bosom), and lo! it was white for the beholders.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:109: The chiefs of Pharaoh’s people said: Lo! this is some knowing wizard,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:110: Who would expel you from your land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:111: They said (unto Pharaoh): Put him off (a while) - him and his brother - and send into the cities summoners,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:112: To bring each knowing wizard unto thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:113: And the wizards came to Pharaoh, saying: Surely there will be a reward for us if we are victors.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:114: He answered: Yes, and surely ye shall be of those brought near (to me).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:115: They said: O Moses! Either throw (first) or let us be the first throwers ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:116: He said: Throw! And when they threw they cast a spell upon the people’s eyes, and overawed them, and produced a mighty spell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:117: And We inspired Moses (saying): Throw thy staff! And lo! it swallowed up their lying show.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:118: Thus was the Truth vindicated and that which they were doing was made vain
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:119: Thus were they there defeated and brought low.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:120: And the wizards fell down prostrate,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:121: Crying: We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:122: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:123: Pharaoh said: Ye believe in Him before I give you leave! Lo! this is the plot that ye have plotted in the city that ye may drive its people hence.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:124: Surely I shall have your hands and feet cut off upon alternate sides.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:125: They said: Lo! We are about to return unto our Lord!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:126: Thou takest vengeance on us only forasmuch as we believed the tokens of our Lord when they came unto us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:127: The chiefs of Pharaoh’s people said: (O King), wilt thou suffer Moses and his people to make mischief in the land, and flout thee and thy gods ? He said: We will slay their sons and spare their women, for lo! we are in power over them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:128: And Moses said unto his people: Seek help in Allah and endure.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:129: They said: We suffered hurt before thou camest unto us, and since thou hast come unto us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:130: And we straitened Pharaoh’s folk with famine and dearth of fruits, that peradventure they might heed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:131: But whenever good befell them, they said: This is ours; and whenever evil smote them they ascribed it to the evil auspices of Moses and those with him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:132: And they said: Whatever portent thou bringest wherewith to bewitch us, we shall not put faith in thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:133: So We sent against them the flood and the locusts and the vermin and the frogs and the blood - a succession of clear signs.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:134: And when the terror fell on them they cried: O Moses! Pray for us unto thy Lord, because He hath a covenant with thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:135: But when We did remove from them the terror for a term which they must reach, behold! they broke their covenant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:136: Therefore We took retribution from them; therefore We drowned them in the sea: because they denied Our revelations and were heedless of them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:137: And We caused the folk who were despised to inherit the eastern parts of the land and the western parts thereof which We had blessed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:138: And We brought the Children of Israel across the sea, and they came unto a people who were given up to idols which they had.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:139: Lo! as for these, their way will be destroyed and all that they are doing is in vain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:140: He said: Shall I seek for you a god other than Allah when He hath favoured you above (all) creatures ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:141: And (remember) when We did deliver you from Pharaoh’s folk who were afflicting you with dreadful torment, slaughtering your sons and sparing your women.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:142: And when We did appoint for Moses thirty nights (of solitude), and added to them ten, and he completed the whole time appointed by his Lord of forty nights; and Moses said unto his brother, Aaron: Take my place among the people.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:143: And when Moses came to Our appointed tryst and his Lord had spoken unto him, he said: My Lord! Show me (Thy Self), that I may gaze upon Thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:144: He said: O Moses! I have preferred thee above mankind by My messages and by My speaking (unto thee).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:145: And We wrote for him, upon the tablets, the lesson to be drawn from all things and the explanation of all things, then (bade him): Hold it fast; and command thy people (saying): Take the better (course made clear) therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:146: I shall turn away from My revelations those who magnify themselves wrongfully in the earth, and if they see each token believe it not, and if they see the way of righteousness choose it nor for (their) way, and if they see the way of error choose if for (their) way.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:147: Those who deny Our revelations and the meeting of the Hereafter, their works are fruitless.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:148: And the folk of Moses, after (he left them), chose a calf (for worship), (made) out of their ornaments, of saffron hue, which gave a lowing sound.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:149: And when they feared the consequences thereof and saw that they had gone astray, they said: Unless our Lord have mercy on us and forgive us, we verily are of the lost.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:150: And when Moses returned unto his people, angry and grieved, he said: Evil is that (course) which ye took after I had left you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:151: He said: My Lord! Have mercy on me and on my brother; bring us into Thy mercy, Thou the Most Merciful of all who show mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:152: Lo! Those who chose the calf (for worship), terror from their Lord and humiliation will come upon them in the life of the world.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:153: But those who do ill-deeds and afterward repent and believe - lo! for them, afterward, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:154: Then, when the anger of Moses abated, he took up the tablets, and in their inscription there was guidance and mercy for all those who fear their Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:155: And Moses chose of his people seventy men for Our appointed tryst and, when the trembling came on them, he said: My Lord! If Thou hadst willed Thou hadst destroyed them long before, and me with them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:156: And ordain for us in this world that which is good, and in the Hereafter (that which is good), Lo! We have turned unto Thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:157: Those who follow the messenger, the Prophet who can neither read nor write, whom they will find described in the Torah and the Gospel (which are) with them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:158: Say (O Muhammad): O mankind! Lo! I am the messenger of Allah to you all - (the messenger of) Him unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:159: And of Moses’ folk there is a community who lead with truth and establish justice therewith.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:160: We divided them into twelve tribes, nations; and We inspired Moses, when his people asked him for water, saying: Smite with thy staff the rock! And there gushed forth therefrom twelve springs, so that each tribe knew their drinking-place.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:161: And when it was said unto them: Dwell in this township and eat therefrom whence ye will, and say "Repentance," and enter the gate prostrate; We shall forgive you your sins; We shall increase (reward) for the right-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:162: But those of them who did wrong changed the word which had been told them for another saying, and We sent down upon them wrath from heaven for their wrongdoing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:163: Ask them (O Muhammad) of the township that was by the sea, how they did break the Sabbath, how their big fish came unto them visibly upon their Sabbath day and on a day when they did not keep Sabbath came they not unto them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:164: And when a community among them said: Why preach ye to a folk whom Allah is about to destroy or punish with an awful doom, they said: In order to be free from guilt before your Lord, and that haply they may ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:165: And when they forgot that whereof they had been reminded, We rescued those who forbade wrong, and visited those who did wrong with dreadful punishment because they were evil-livers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:166: So when they took pride in that which they had been forbidden, We said unto them: Be ye apes despised and loathed!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:167: And (remember) when thy Lord proclaimed that He would raise against them till the Day of Resurrection those who would lay on them a cruel torment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:168: And We have sundered them in the earth as (separate) nations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:169: And a generation hath succeeded them who inherited the scriptures.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:170: And as for those who make (men) keep the Scripture, and establish worship - lo! We squander not the wages of reformers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:171: And when We shook the Mount above them as it were a covering, and they supposed that it was going to fall upon them (and We said): Hold fast that which We have given you, and remember that which is therein, that ye may ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:172: And (remember) when thy Lord brought forth from the Children of Adam, from their reins, their seed, and made them testify of themselves, (saying): Am I not your Lord ? They said: Yea, verily.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:173: Or lest ye should say: (It is) only (that) our fathers ascribed partners to Allah of old and we were (their) seed after them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:174: Thus we detail the revelations, that haply they may return.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:175: Recite unto them the tale of him to whom We gave Our revelations, but he sloughed them off, so Satan overtook him and he became of those who lead astray.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:176: And had We willed We could have raised him by their means, but he clung to the earth and followed his own lust.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:177: Evil as an example are the folk who denied Our revelations, and were wont to wrong themselves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:178: He whom Allah leadeth, he indeed is led aright, while he whom Allah sendeth astray - they indeed are losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:179: Already have We urged unto hell many of the jinn and humankind, having hearts wherewith they understand not, and having eyes wherewith they see not, and having ears wherewith they hear not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:181: And of those whom We created there is a nation who guide with the Truth and establish justice therewith.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:182: And those who deny Our revelations - step by step We lead them on from whence they know not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:183: I give them rein (for) lo! My scheme is strong.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:184: Have they not bethought them (that) there is no madness in their comrade ? He is but a plain warner.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:185: Have they not considered the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and what things Allah hath created, and that it may be that their own term draweth nigh ? In what fact after this will they believe ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:186: Those whom Allah sendeth astray, there is no guide for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:187: They ask thee of the (destined) Hour, when will it come to port.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:188: Say: For myself I have no power to benefit, nor power to hurt, save that which Allah willeth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:189: He it is Who did create you from a single soul, and therefrom did make his mate that he might take rest in her.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:190: But when He gave unto them aright, they ascribed unto Him partners in respect of that which He had given them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:191: Attribute they as partners to Allah those who created naught, but are themselves created,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:192: And cannot give them help, nor can they help themselves ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:193: And if ye call them to the Guidance, they follow you not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:194: Lo! those on whom ye call beside Allah are slaves like unto you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:195: Have they feet wherewith they walk, or have they hands wherewith they hold, or have they eyes wherewith they see, or have they ears wherewith they hear ? Say: Call upon your (so-called) partners (of Allah), and then contrive against me, spare me not!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:196: Lo! my Protecting Friend is Allah Who revealeth the Scripture.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:197: They on whom ye call beside Him have no power to help you, nor can they help you, nor can they help themselves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:198: And if ye (Muslims) call them to the guidance they hear not; and thou (Muhammad) seest them looking toward thee, but they see not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:199: Keep to forgiveness (O Muhammad), and enjoin kindness, and turn away from the ignorant.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:200: And if a slander from the devil wound thee, then seek refuge in Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:201: Lo! those who ward off (evil), when a glamour from the devil troubleth them, they do but remember (Allah’s Guidance) and behold them seers!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:202: Their brethren plunge them further into error and cease not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:203: And when thou bringest not a verse for them they say: Why hast thou not chosen it ? Say: I follow only that which is inspired in me from my Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:204: And when the Qur’an is recited, give ear to it and pay heed, that ye may obtain mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:205: And do thou (O Muhammad) remember thy Lord within thyself humbly and with awe, below thy breath, at morn and evening.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 7:206: Lo! those who are with thy Lord are not too proud to do Him service, but they praise Him and adore Him.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:2: A Book revealed unto thee,- So let thy heart be oppressed no more by any difficulty on that account,- that with it thou mightest warn (the erring) and teach the Believers).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:3: Follow (O men!) the revelation given unto you from your Lord, and follow not, as friends or protectors, other than Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:4: How many towns have We destroyed (for their sins)? Our punishment took them on a sudden by night or while they slept for their afternoon rest.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:5: When (thus) Our punishment took them, no cry did they utter but this: "Indeed we did wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:6: Then shall we question those to whom Our message was sent and those by whom We sent it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:7: And verily, We shall recount their whole story with knowledge, for We were never absent (at any time or place).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:8: The balance that day will be true (to nicety): those whose scale (of good) will be heavy, will prosper:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:9: Those whose scale will be light, will be their souls in perdition, for that they wrongfully treated Our signs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:10: It is We Who have placed you with authority on earth, and provided you therein with means for the fulfilment of your life: small are the thanks that ye give!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:11: It is We Who created you and gave you shape; then We bade the angels bow down to Adam, and they bowed down; not so Iblis; He refused to be of those who bow down.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:12: (God) said: "What prevented thee from bowing down when I commanded thee?" He said: "I am better than he: Thou didst create me from fire, and him from clay.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:13: (God) said: "Get thee down from this: it is not for thee to be arrogant here: get out, for thou art of the meanest (of creatures).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:14: He said: "Give me respite till the day they are raised up.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:15: (God) said: "Be thou among those who have respite.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:16: He said: "Because thou hast thrown me out of the way, lo! I will lie in wait for them on thy straight way:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:17: "Then will I assault them from before them and behind them, from their right and their left: Nor wilt thou find, in most of them, gratitude (for thy mercies).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:18: (God) said: "Get out from this, disgraced and expelled.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:19: "O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the Garden, and enjoy (its good things) as ye wish: but approach not this tree, or ye run into harm and transgression.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:20: Then began Satan to whisper suggestions to them, bringing openly before their minds all their shame that was hidden from them (before): he said: "Your Lord only forbade you this tree, lest ye should become angels or such beings as live for ever.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:21: And he swore to them both, that he was their sincere adviser.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:22: So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the tree, their shame became manifest to them, and they began to sew together the leaves of the garden over their bodies.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:23: They said: "Our Lord! We have wronged our own souls: If thou forgive us not and bestow not upon us Thy Mercy, we shall certainly be lost.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:25: He said: "Therein shall ye live, and therein shall ye die; but from it shall ye be taken out (at last).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:26: O ye Children of Adam! We have bestowed raiment upon you to cover your shame, as well as to be an adornment to you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:27: O ye Children of Adam! Let not Satan seduce you, in the same manner as He got your parents out of the Garden, stripping them of their raiment, to expose their shame: for he and his tribe watch you from a position where ye cannot see them: We made the evil ones friends (only) to those without faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:28: When they do aught that is shameful, they say: "We found our fathers doing so"; and "God commanded us thus": Say: "Nay, God never commands what is shameful: do ye say of God what ye know not?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:29: Say: "My Lord hath commanded justice; and that ye set your whole selves (to Him) at every time and place of prayer, and call upon Him, making your devotion sincere as in His sight: such as He created you in the beginning, so shall ye return.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:30: Some He hath guided: Others have (by their choice) deserved the loss of their way; in that they took the evil ones, in preference to God, for their friends and protectors, and think that they receive guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:31: O Children of Adam! wear your beautiful apparel at every time and place of prayer: eat and drink: But waste not by excess, for God loveth not the wasters.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:32: Say: Who hath forbidden the beautiful (gifts) of God, which He hath produced for His servants, and the things, clean and pure, (which He hath provided) for sustenance? Say: They are, in the life of this world, for those who believe, (and) purely for them on the Day of Judgment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:33: Say: the things that my Lord hath indeed forbidden are: shameful deeds, whether open or secret; sins and trespasses against truth or reason; assigning of partners to God, for which He hath given no authority; and saying things about God of which ye have no knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:34: To every people is a term appointed: when their term is reached, not an hour can they cause delay, nor (an hour) can they advance (it in anticipation).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:35: O ye Children of Adam! whenever there come to you apostles from amongst you, rehearsing My signs unto you,- those who are righteous and mend (their lives),- on them shall be no fear nor shall they grieve.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:36: But those who reject Our signs and treat them with arrogance,- they are companions of the Fire, to dwell therein (for ever).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:37: Who is more unjust than one who invents a lie against God or rejects His Signs? For such, their portion appointed must reach them from the Book (of decrees): until, when our messengers (of death) arrive and take their souls, they say: "Where are the things that ye used to invoke besides God?" They will reply, "They have left us in the lurch," And they will bear witness against themselves, that they had rejected God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:38: He will say: "Enter ye in the company of the peoples who passed away before you - men and jinns, - into the Fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:39: Then the first will say to the last: "See then! No advantage have ye over us; so taste ye of the penalty for all that ye did !"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:40: To those who reject Our signs and treat them with arrogance, no opening will there be of the gates of heaven, nor will they enter the garden, until the camel can pass through the eye of the needle: Such is Our reward for those in sin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:41: For them there is Hell, as a couch (below) and folds and folds of covering above: such is Our requital of those who do wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:42: But those who believe and work righteousness,- no burden do We place on any soul, but that which it can bear,- they will be Companions of the Garden, therein to dwell (for ever).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:43: And We shall remove from their hearts any lurking sense of injury;- beneath them will be rivers flowing;- and they shall say: "Praise be to God, who hath guided us to this (felicity): never could we have found guidance, had it not been for the guidance of God: indeed it was the truth, that the apostles of our Lord brought unto us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:44: The Companions of the Garden will call out to the Companions of the Fire: "We have indeed found the promises of our Lord to us true: Have you also found Your Lord’s promises true?" They shall say, "Yes"; but a crier shall proclaim between them: "The curse of God is on the wrong-doers;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:45: "Those who would hinder (men) from the path of God and would seek in it something crooked: they were those who denied the Hereafter.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:46: Between them shall be a veil, and on the heights will be men who would know every one by his marks: they will call out to the Companions of the Garden, "peace on you": they will not have entered, but they will have an assurance (thereof).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:47: When their eyes shall be turned towards the Companions of the Fire, they will say: "Our Lord! send us not to the company of the wrong-doers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:48: The men on the heights will call to certain men whom they will know from their marks, saying: "Of what profit to you were your hoards and your arrogant ways?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:49: "Behold! are these not the men whom you swore that God with His Mercy would never bless? Enter ye the Garden: no fear shall be on you, nor shall ye grieve.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:50: The Companions of the Fire will call to the Companions of the Garden: "Pour down to us water or anything that God doth provide for your sustenance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:51: "Such as took their religion to be mere amusement and play, and were deceived by the life of the world.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:52: For We had certainly sent unto them a Book, based on knowledge, which We explained in detail,- a guide and a mercy to all who believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:53: Do they just wait for the final fulfilment of the event? On the day the event is finally fulfilled, those who disregarded it before will say: "The apostles of our Lord did indeed bring true (tidings).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:54: Your Guardian-Lord is God, Who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and is firmly established on the throne (of authority): He draweth the night as a veil o’er the day, each seeking the other in rapid succession: He created the sun, the moon, and the stars, (all) governed by laws under His command.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:55: Call on your Lord with humility and in private: for God loveth not those who trespass beyond bounds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:56: Do no mischief on the earth, after it hath been set in order, but call on Him with fear and longing (in your hearts): for the Mercy of God is (always) near to those who do good.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:57: It is He Who sendeth the winds like heralds of glad tidings, going before His mercy: when they have carried the heavy-laden clouds, We drive them to a land that is dead, make rain to descend thereon, and produce every kind of harvest therewith: thus shall We raise up the dead: perchance ye may remember.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:58: From the land that is clean and good, by the will of its Cherisher, springs up produce, (rich) after its kind: but from the land that is bad, springs up nothing but that which is niggardly: thus do we explain the signs by various (symbols) to those who are grateful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:59: We sent Noah to his people.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:60: The leaders of his people said: "Ah! we see thee evidently wandering (in mind).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:61: He said: "O my people! No wandering is there in my (mind): on the contrary I am an apostle from the Lord and Cherisher of the worlds!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:62: "I but fulfil towards you the duties of my Lord’s mission: Sincere is my advice to you, and I know from God something that ye know not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:63: "Do ye wonder that there hath come to you a message from your Lord, through a man of your own people, to warn you,- so that ye may fear God and haply receive His Mercy?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:64: But they rejected him, and We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark: but We overwhelmed in the flood those who rejected Our signs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:65: To the ’Ad people, (We sent) Hud, one of their (own) brethren: He said: O my people! worship God! ye have no other god but Him will ye not fear (God)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:66: The leaders of the Unbelievers among his people said: "Ah! we see thou art an imbecile!" and "We think thou art a liar!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:67: He said: "O my people! I am no imbecile, but (I am) an apostle from the Lord and Cherisher of the worlds!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:68: "I but fulfil towards you the duties of my Lord’s mission: I am to you a sincere and trustworthy adviser.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:69: "Do ye wonder that there hath come to you a message from your Lord through a man of your own people, to warn you? call in remembrance that He made you inheritors after the people of Noah, and gave you a stature tall among the nations.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:70: They said: "Comest thou to us, that we may worship God alone, and give up the cult of our fathers? bring us what thou threatenest us with, if so be that thou tellest the truth!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:71: He said: "Punishment and wrath have already come upon you from your Lord: dispute ye with me over names which ye have devised - ye and your fathers,- without authority from God? then wait: I am amongst you, also waiting.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:72: We saved him and those who adhered to him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:73: To the Thamud people (We sent) Salih, one of their own brethren: He said: "O my people! worship God: ye have no other god but Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:74: "And remember how He made you inheritors after the ’Ad people and gave you habitations in the land: ye build for yourselves palaces and castles in (open) plains, and carve out homes in the mountains; so bring to remembrance the benefits (ye have received) from God, and refrain from evil and mischief on the earth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:75: The leaders of the arrogant party among his people said to those who were reckoned powerless - those among them who believed: "know ye indeed that Salih is an apostle from his Lord?" They said: "We do indeed believe in the revelation which hath been sent through him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:76: The Arrogant party said: "For our part, we reject what ye believe in.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:77: Then they ham-strung the she-camel, and insolently defied the order of their Lord, saying: "O Salih! bring about thy threats, if thou art an apostle (of God)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:78: So the earthquake took them unawares, and they lay prostrate in their homes in the morning!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:79: So Salih left them, saying: "O my people! I did indeed convey to you the message for which I was sent by my Lord: I gave you good counsel, but ye love not good counsellors!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:80: We also (sent) Lut: He said to his people: "Do ye commit lewdness such as no people in creation (ever) committed before you?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:81: "For ye practise your lusts on men in preference to women : ye are indeed a people transgressing beyond bounds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:82: And his people gave no answer but this: they said, "Drive them out of your city: these are indeed men who want to be clean and pure!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:83: But we saved him and his family, except his wife: she was of those who legged behind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:84: And we rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): Then see what was the end of those who indulged in sin and crime!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:85: To the Madyan people We sent Shu’aib, one of their own brethren: he said: "O my people! worship God; Ye have no other god but Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:86: "And squat not on every road, breathing threats, hindering from the path of God those who believe in Him, and seeking in it something crooked; But remember how ye were little, and He gave you increase.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:87: "And if there is a party among you who believes in the message with which I have been sent, and a party which does not believe, hold yourselves in patience until God doth decide between us: for He is the best to decide.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:88: The leaders, the arrogant party among his people, said: "O Shu’aib! we shall certainly drive thee out of our city - (thee) and those who believe with thee; or else ye (thou and they) shall have to return to our ways and religion.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:89: "We should indeed invent a lie against God, if we returned to your ways after God hath rescued us therefrom; nor could we by any manner of means return thereto unless it be as in the will and plan of God, Our Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:90: The leaders, the unbelievers among his people, said: "If ye follow Shu’aib, be sure then ye are ruined!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:91: But the earthquake took them unawares, and they lay prostrate in their homes before the morning!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:92: The men who reject Shu’aib became as if they had never been in the homes where they had flourished: the men who rejected Shu’aib - it was they who were ruined!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:93: So Shu’aib left them, saying: "O my people! I did indeed convey to you the messages for which I was sent by my Lord: I gave you good counsel, but how shall I lament over a people who refuse to believe!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:94: Whenever We sent a prophet to a town, We took up its people in suffering and adversity, in order that they might learn humility.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:95: Then We changed their suffering into prosperity, until they grew and multiplied, and began to say: "Our fathers (too) were touched by suffering and affluence" .
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:96: If the people of the towns had but believed and feared God, We should indeed have opened out to them (All kinds of) blessings from heaven and earth; but they rejected (the truth), and We brought them to book for their misdeeds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:97: Did the people of the towns feel secure against the coming of Our wrath by night while they were asleep?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:98: Or else did they feel secure against its coming in broad daylight while they played about (care-free)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:99: Did they then feel secure against the plan of God?- but no one can feel secure from the Plan of God, except those (doomed) to ruin!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:100: To those who inherit the earth in succession to its (previous) possessors, is it not a guiding, (lesson) that, if We so willed, We could punish them (too) for their sins, and seal up their hearts so that they could not hear?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:101: Such were the towns whose story We (thus) relate unto thee: There came indeed to them their apostles with clear (signs): But they would not believe what they had rejected before.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:102: Most of them We found not men (true) to their covenant: but most of them We found rebellious and disobedient.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:103: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they wrongfully rejected them: So see what was the end of those who made mischief.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:104: Moses said: "O Pharaoh! I am an apostle from the Lord of the worlds,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:105: One for whom it is right to say nothing but truth about God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:106: (Pharaoh) said: "If indeed thou hast come with a Sign, show it forth,- if thou tellest the truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:107: Then (Moses) threw his rod, and behold! it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:108: And he drew out his hand, and behold! it was white to all beholders!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:109: Said the Chiefs of the people of Pharaoh: "This is indeed a sorcerer well-versed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:110: "His plan is to get you out of your land: then what is it ye counsel?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:111: They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while); and send to the cities men to collect-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:112: And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:113: So there came the sorcerers to Pharaoh: They said, "of course we shall have a (suitable) reward if we win!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:114: He said: "Yea, (and more),- for ye shall in that case be (raised to posts) nearest (to my person).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:115: They said: "O Moses! wilt thou throw (first), or shall we have the (first) throw?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:117: We put it into Moses’s mind by inspiration: "Throw (now) thy rod":and behold! it swallows up straight away all the falsehoods which they fake!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:118: Thus truth was confirmed, and all that they did was made of no effect.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:119: So the (great ones) were vanquished there and then, and were made to look small.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:120: But the sorcerers fell down prostrate in adoration.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:121: Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:123: Said Pharaoh: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this is a trick which ye have planned in the city to drive out its people: but soon shall ye know (the consequences).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:124: "Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on apposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:125: They said: "For us, We are but sent back unto our Lord:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:126: "But thou dost wreak thy vengeance on us simply because we believed in the Signs of our Lord when they reached us! Our Lord! pour out on us patience and constancy, and take our souls unto thee as Muslims (who bow to thy will)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:127: Said the chiefs of Pharaoh’s people: "Wilt thou leave Moses and his people, to spread mischief in the land, and to abandon thee and thy gods?" He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only) their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power) irresistible.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:128: Said Moses to his people: "Pray for help from God, and (wait) in patience and constancy: for the earth is God’s, to give as a heritage to such of His servants as He pleaseth; and the end is (best) for the righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:129: They said: "We have had (nothing but) trouble, both before and after thou camest to us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:130: We punished the people of Pharaoh with years (of droughts) and shortness of crops; that they might receive admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:131: But when good (times) came, they said, "This is due to us;" When gripped by calamity, they ascribed it to evil omens connected with Moses and those with him! Behold! in truth the omens of evil are theirs in God’s sight, but most of them do not understand!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:132: They said (to Moses): "Whatever be the Signs thou bringest, to work therewith thy sorcery on us, we shall never believe in thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:133: So We sent (plagues) on them: Wholesale death, Locusts, Lice, Frogs, And Blood: Signs openly self-explained: but they were steeped in arrogance,- a people given to sin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:134: Every time the penalty fell on them, they said: "O Moses! on your behalf call on thy Lord in virtue of his promise to thee: If thou wilt remove the penalty from us, we shall truly believe in thee, and we shall send away the Children of Israel with thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:135: But every time We removed the penalty from them according to a fixed term which they had to fulfil,- Behold! they broke their word!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:136: So We exacted retribution from them: We drowned them in the sea, because they rejected Our Signs and failed to take warning from them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:137: And We made a people, considered weak (and of no account), inheritors of lands in both east and west, - lands whereon We sent down Our blessings.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:138: We took the Children of Israel (with safety) across the sea.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:139: "As to these folk,- the cult they are in is (but) a fragment of a ruin, and vain is the (worship) which they practise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:140: He said: "Shall I seek for you a god other than the (true) God, when it is God Who hath endowed you with gifts above the nations?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:141: And remember We rescued you from Pharaoh’s people, who afflicted you with the worst of penalties, who slew your male children and saved alive your females: in that was a momentous trial from your Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:142: We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed (the period) with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with his Lord, forty nights.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:143: When Moses came to the place appointed by Us, and his Lord addressed him, He said: "O my Lord! show (Thyself) to me, that I may look upon thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:144: (God) said: "O Moses! I have chosen thee above (other) men, by the mission I (have given thee) and the words I (have spoken to thee): take then the (revelation) which I give thee, and be of those who give thanks.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:145: And We ordained laws for him in the tablets in all matters, both commanding and explaining all things, (and said): "Take and hold these with firmness, and enjoin thy people to hold fast by the best in the precepts: soon shall I show you the homes of the wicked,- (How they lie desolate).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:146: Those who behave arrogantly on the earth in defiance of right - them will I turn away from My signs: Even if they see all the signs, they will not believe in them; and if they see the way of right conduct, they will not adopt it as the way; but if they see the way of error, that is the way they will adopt.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:147: Those who reject Our signs and the meeting in the Hereafter,- vain are their deeds: Can they expect to be rewarded except as they have wrought?
