Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:148: The people of Moses made, in his absence, out of their ornaments, the image of calf, (for worship): it seemed to low: did they not see that it could neither speak to them, nor show them the way? They took it for worship and they did wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:149: When they repented, and saw that they had erred, they said: "If our Lord have not mercy upon us and forgive us, we shall indeed be of those who perish.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:150: When Moses came back to his people, angry and grieved, he said: "Evil it is that ye have done in my place in my absence: did ye make haste to bring on the judgment of your Lord?" He put down the tablets, seized his brother by (the hair of) his head, and dragged him to him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:151: Moses prayed: "O my Lord! forgive me and my brother! admit us to Thy mercy! for Thou art the Most Merciful of those who show mercy!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:152: Those who took the calf (for worship) will indeed be overwhelmed with wrath from their Lord, and with shame in this life: thus do We recompense those who invent (falsehoods).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:153: But those who do wrong but repent thereafter and (truly) believe,- verily thy Lord is thereafter Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:154: When the anger of Moses was appeased, he took up the tablets: in the writing thereon was guidance and Mercy for such as fear their Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:155: And Moses chose seventy of his people for Our place of meeting: when they were seized with violent quaking, he prayed: "O my Lord! if it had been Thy will Thou couldst have destroyed, long before, both them and me: wouldst Thou destroy us for the deeds of the foolish ones among us? this is no more than Thy trial: by it Thou causest whom Thou wilt to stray, and Thou leadest whom Thou wilt into the right path.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:156: "And ordain for us that which is good, in this life and in the Hereafter: for we have turned unto Thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:157: "Those who follow the apostle, the unlettered Prophet, whom they find mentioned in their own (scriptures),- in the law and the Gospel;- for he commands them what is just and forbids them what is evil; he allows them as lawful what is good (and pure) and prohibits them from what is bad (and impure); He releases them from their heavy burdens and from the yokes that are upon them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:158: Say: "O men! I am sent unto you all, as the Apostle of God, to Whom belongeth the dominion of the heavens and the earth: there is no god but He: it is He That giveth both life and death.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:159: Of the people of Moses there is a section who guide and do justice in the light of truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:160: We divided them into twelve tribes or nations.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:161: And remember it was said to them: "Dwell in this town and eat therein as ye wish, but say the word of humility and enter the gate in a posture of humility: We shall forgive you your faults; We shall increase (the portion of) those who do good.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:162: But the transgressors among them changed the word from that which had been given them so we sent on them a plague from heaven.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:163: Ask them concerning the town standing close by the sea.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:164: When some of them said: "Why do ye preach to a people whom God will destroy or visit with a terrible punishment?"- said the preachers:" To discharge our duty to your Lord, and perchance they may fear Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:165: When they disregarded the warnings that had been given them, We rescued those who forbade Evil; but We visited the wrong-doers with a grievous punishment because they were given to transgression.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:166: When in their insolence they transgressed (all) prohibitions, We said to them: "Be ye apes, despised and rejected.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:167: Behold! thy Lord did declare that He would send against them, to the Day of Judgment, those who would afflict them with grievous penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:168: We broke them up into sections on this earth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:169: After them succeeded an (evil) generation: They inherited the Book, but they chose (for themselves) the vanities of this world, saying (for excuse): "(Everything) will be forgiven us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:170: As to those who hold fast by the Book and establish regular prayer,- never shall We suffer the reward of the righteous to perish.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:171: When We shook the Mount over them, as if it had been a canopy, and they thought it was going to fall on them (We said): "Hold firmly to what We have given you, and bring (ever) to remembrance what is therein; perchance ye may fear God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:172: When thy Lord drew forth from the Children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants, and made them testify concerning themselves, (saying): "Am I not your Lord (who cherishes and sustains you)?"- They said: "Yea! We do testify!" (This), lest ye should say on the Day of Judgment: "Of this we were never mindful":
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:173: Or lest ye should say: "Our fathers before us may have taken false gods, but we are (their) descendants after them: wilt Thou then destroy us because of the deeds of men who were futile?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:174: Thus do We explain the signs in detail; and perchance they may turn (unto Us).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:175: Relate to them the story of the man to whom We sent Our signs, but he passed them by: so Satan followed him up, and he went astray.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:176: If it had been Our will, We should have elevated him with Our signs; but he inclined to the earth, and followed his own vain desires.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:177: Evil as an example are people who reject Our signs and wrong their own souls.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:178: Whom God doth guide,- he is on the right path: whom He rejects from His guidance,- such are the persons who perish.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:179: Many are the Jinns and men we have made for Hell: They have hearts wherewith they understand not, eyes wherewith they see not, and ears wherewith they hear not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:180: The most beautiful names belong to God: so call on him by them; but shun such men as use profanity in his names: for what they do, they will soon be requited.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:181: Of those We have created are people who direct (others) with truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:182: Those who reject Our signs, We shall gradually visit with punishment, in ways they perceive not;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:183: Respite will I grant unto them: for My scheme is strong (and unfailing).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:184: Do they not reflect? Their companion is not seized with madness: he is but a perspicuous warner.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:185: Do they see nothing in the government of the heavens and the earth and all that God hath created? (Do they not see) that it may well be that their terms is nigh drawing to an end? In what message after this will they then believe?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:186: To such as God rejects from His guidance, there can be no guide: He will leave them in their trespasses, wandering in distraction.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:187: They ask thee about the (final) Hour - when will be its appointed time? Say: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord (alone): None but He can reveal as to when it will occur.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:188: Say: "I have no power over any good or harm to myself except as God willeth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:189: It is He Who created you from a single person, and made his mate of like nature, in order that he might dwell with her (in love).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:190: But when He giveth them a goodly child, they ascribe to others a share in the gift they have received: but God is exalted high above the partners they ascribe to Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:191: Do they indeed ascribe to Him as partners things that can create nothing, but are themselves created?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:192: No aid can they give them, nor can they aid themselves!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:193: If ye call them to guidance, they will not obey: For you it is the same whether ye call them or ye hold your peace!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:194: Verily those whom ye call upon besides God are servants like unto you: Call upon them, and let them listen to your prayer, if ye are (indeed) truthful!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:195: Have they feet to walk with? Or hands to lay hold with? Or eyes to see with? Or ears to hear with? Say: "Call your ’god-partners’, scheme (your worst) against me, and give me no respite!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:196: "For my Protector is God, Who revealed the Book (from time to time), and He will choose and befriend the righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:197: "But those ye call upon besides Him, are unable to help you, and indeed to help themselves.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:198: If thou callest them to guidance, they hear not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:199: Hold to forgiveness; command what is right; But turn away from the ignorant.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:200: If a suggestion from Satan assail thy (mind), seek refuge with God; for He heareth and knoweth (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:201: Those who fear God, when a thought of evil from Satan assaults them, bring God to remembrance, when lo! they see (aright)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:202: But their brethren (the evil ones) plunge them deeper into error, and never relax (their efforts).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:203: If thou bring them not a revelation, they say: "Why hast thou not got it together?" Say: "I but follow what is revealed to me from my Lord: this is (nothing but) lights from your Lord, and Guidance, and mercy, for any who have faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:204: When the Qur’an is read, listen to it with attention, and hold your peace: that ye may receive Mercy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:205: And do thou (O reader!) Bring thy Lord to remembrance in thy (very) soul, with humility and in reverence, without loudness in words, in the mornings and evenings; and be not thou of those who are unheedful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 7:206: Those who are near to thy Lord, disdain not to do Him worship: They celebrate His praises, and bow down before Him.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:2: A Book sent down to thee -- so let there be no impediment in thy breast because of it -- to warn thereby, and as a reminder to believers:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:3: Follow what has been sent down to you from your Lord, and follow no friends other than He; little do you remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:4: How many a city We have destroyed! Our might came upon it at night, or while they took their ease in the noontide,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:5: and they but cried, when Our might came upon there, ’We were evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:6: So We shall question those unto whom a Message was sent, and We shall question the Envoys,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:7: and We shall relate to them with knowledge; assuredly We were not absent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:8: The weighing that day is true; he whose scales are heavy -- they are the prosperers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:9: and he whose scales are light -- they have lost their soul for wronging Our signs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:10: We have established you in the earth and there appointed for you livelihood; little thanks you show.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:11: We created you, then We shaped you, then We said to the angels: ’Bow yourselves to Adam’; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis -- he was not of those that bowed themselves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:12: Said He, ’What prevented thee to bow thyself, when I commanded thee?’ Said he, ’I am better than he; Thou createdst me of fire, and him Thou createdst of clay.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:13: Said He, ’Get thee down out of it; it is not for thee to wax proud here, so go thou forth; surely thou art among the humbled.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:14: Said he, ’Respite me till the day they shall be raised.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:15: Said He, ’Thou art among the ones that are respited.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:16: Said he, ’Now, for Thy perverting me, I shall surely sit in ambush for them on Thy straight path;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:17: then I shall come on them from before them and from behind them, from their right hands and their left hands; Thou wilt not find most of them thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:18: Said He, ’Go thou forth from it, despised and banished.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:19: ’O Adam, inherit, thou and thy wife, the Garden, and eat of where you will, but come not nigh this tree, lest you be of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:20: Then Satan whispered to them, to reveal to them that which was hidden from them of their shameful parts.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:21: And he swore to them, ’Truly, I am for you a sincere adviser.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:22: So he led them on by delusion; and when they tasted the tree, their shameful parts revealed to them, so they took to stitching upon themselves leaves of the Garden.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:23: They said, ’Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if Thou dost not forgive us, and have mercy upon us, we shall surely be among the lost.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:24: Said He, ’Get you down, each of you an enemy to each.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:25: Said He, ’Therein you shall live, and therein you shall die, and from there you shall be brought forth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:26: Children of Adam! We have sent down on you a garment to cover your shameful parts, and feathers; and the garment of godfearing -- that is better; that is one of God’s signs; haply they will remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:27: Children of Adam! Let not Satan tempt you as he brought your parents out of the Garden, stripping them of their garments to show them their shameful parts.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:28: And whenever they commit an indecency they say, ’We found our fathers practising it, and God has commanded us to do it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:30: a part He guided, and a part justly disposed to error -- they have taken Satans for friends instead of God, and think them guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:31: Children of Adam! Take your adornment at every place of worship; and eat and drink, but be you not prodigal; He loves not the prodigal.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:32: Say: ’Who has forbidden the ornament of God which He brought forth for His servants, and the good things of His providing?’ Say: ’These, on the Day of Resurrection, shall be exclusively for those who believed in this present life.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:33: Say: ’My Lord has only forbidden indecencies, the inward and the outward, and sin, and unjust insolence, and that you associate with God that for which He sent down never authority, and that you say concerning God such as you know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:34: To every nation a term; when their term comes they shall not put it back by a single hour nor put it forward.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:35: Children of Adam! If there should come to you Messengers from among you, relating to you My signs, then whosoever is godfearing and makes amends -- no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:36: And those that cry lies to Our signs, and wax proud against them -- those shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, therein dwelling forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:37: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, or cries lies to His signs? Those - their portion of the Book shall reach them; till, when Our messengers come to them, to take them away, they say, ’Where is that you were calling on, beside God?’ They will say, ’They have gone astray from us, and they will bear witness against themselves that they were unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:38: He will say, ’Enter among nations that passed away before you, jinn and mankind, into the Fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:39: The first of them shall say to the last of them, ’You have no superiority over us, then; so taste the chastisement for what you have been earning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:40: Those that cry lies to Our signs and wax proud against them the gates of heaven shall not be opened to them, nor shall they enter Paradise until the camel passes through the eye of the needle.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:41: Gehenna shall be their cradle, above them coverings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:42: And those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- We charge not any soul, save according to its capacity; those are the inhabitants of Paradise, therein dwelling forever;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:43: We shall strip away all rancour that is in their breasts; and underneath them rivers flowing; and they will say, ’Praise belongs to God, who guided us unto this; had God not guided us, we had surely never been guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:44: The inhabitants of Paradise will call to the inhabitants of the Fire: ’We have found that.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:45: who bar from God’s way, desiring to make it crooked, disbelieving in the world to come.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:46: And between them is a veil, and on the Ramparts are men knowing each by their mark, who shall call to the inhabitants of Paradise: ’Peace be upon you! They have not entered it, for all their eagerness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:47: And when their eyes are turned towards the inhabitants of the Fire they shall say, ’Our Lord, do not Thou assign us with the people of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:48: And the dwellers on the Battlements shall call to certain men they know by their sign: ’Your amassing has not availed you, neither your waxing proud.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:49: Are these the ones that you swore God would never reach with mercy?’ ’Enter Paradise; no fear upon you, nor shall you sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:50: The inhabitants of the Fire shall call to the inhabitants of Paradise: ’Pour on us water, or of that God has provided you!’ They will say: ’God has forbidden them to the unbelievers
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:51: who have taken their religion as a diversion and a sport, and whom the present life has deluded.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:52: And We have brought to them a Book that We have well distinguished, resting on knowledge, a guidance and a mercy unto a people that believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:53: Do they look for aught else but its interpretation? The day its interpretation comes, those who before forgot it shall say, ’Indeed, our Lord’s Messengers came with the truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:54: Surely your Lord is God, who created the heavens and the earth in six days -- then sat Himself upon the Throne, covering the day with the night it pursues urgently -- and the sun, and the moon, and the stars subservient, by His command.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:55: Call on your Lord, humbly and secretly; He loves not transgressors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:56: Do not corruption in the land, after it has been set, right; and call on Him fearfully, eagerly -- surely the mercy of God is nigh to the good-doers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:57: It is He who looses the winds, bearing good tidings before His mercy, till, when they are charged with heavy clouds, We drive it to a dead land and therewith send down water, and bring forth, therewith all the fruits.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:58: And the good land -- its vegetation comes forth by the leave of its Lord, and the corrupt -- it comes forth but scantily.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:59: And We sent Noah to his people; and he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other’ than He; truly, I fear for you the chastisement of a dreadful day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:60: Said the Council of his people, ’We see thee in manifest error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:61: Said he, ’My people, there is no error in me; but I am a Messenger from the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:62: I deliver to you the Messages of my Lord, and I advise you sincerely; for I know from God that you know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:63: What, do you wonder that a reminder from your Lord should come to you by the lips of a man from among you? That he may warn you, and you be godfearing, haply to find mercy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:64: But they cried him lies; so We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark, and We drowned those who cried lies to Our signs; assuredly they were a blind people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:65: And to Ad their brother Hood; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He; will you not be godfearing?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:66: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, ’We see thee in folly, and we think that thou art one of the liars.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:67: Said he, ’My people, there is no folly in me; but I am a Messenger from the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:68: I deliver to you the Messages of my Lord; I am your adviser sincere, faithful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:69: What, do you wonder that a reminder from your Lord should come to you by the lips of a man from among you? That he may warn you; and remember when He appointed you as successors after the people of Noah, and increased you in stature broadly; remember God’s bounties; haply you will prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:70: They said, ’Why, hast thou come to us that we may serve God alone, and forsake that our fathers served? Then bring us that thou promisest us, if thou speakest truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:71: Said he, ’Anger and wrath from your Lord have fallen upon you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:72: So We delivered him, and those with him, by a mercy from Us; and We cut off the last remnant of those who cried lies to Our signs and were not believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:73: And to Thamood their brother Salih; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He; there has now come to you a clear sign from your Lord -- this is the She-camel of God, to be a sign for you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:74: And remember when He appointed you successors after Ad, and lodged you in the land, taking to yourselves castles of its plains, and hewing its mountains into houses.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:75: Said the Council of those of his people who waxed proud to those that were abased, to those of them who believed, ’Do you know that Salih is an Envoy from his Lord?’ They said, ’In the Message he has been sent with we are believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:76: Said the ones who waxed proud, ’As for us, we are unbelievers in the thing in which you believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:77: So they hamstrung the She-camel and turned in disdain from the commandment of their Lord, saying, ’O Salih, bring us that thou promisest us, if thou art an Envoy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:78: So the earthquake seized them, and morning found them in their habitation fallen prostrate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:79: So he turned his back on them, and said, ’O my people, I have delivered to you the Message of my Lord, and advised you sincerely; but you do not love sincere advisers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:80: And Lot, when he said to his people, ’What, do you commit such indecency as never any being in all the world committed before you?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:81: See, you approach men lustfully instead of women; no, you are a people that do exceed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:82: And the only answer of his people was that they said, ’Expel them from your city; surely they are folk that keep themselves clean!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:83: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife; she was one of those that tarried.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:84: And We rained down upon them a rain; so behold thou, how was the end of the sinners!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:85: And to Midian their brother Shuaib; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He; there has now come to you a clear sign from your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:86: And do not sit in every path, threatening and barring from God’s way those who believe in Him, desiring to make it crooked.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:87: And if there is a party of you who believe in the Message I have been sent with, and a party who believe not, be patient till God shall judge between us; He is the best of judges.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:88: Said the Council of those of his people who waxed proud, ’We will surely expel thee, O Shuaib, and those who believe with thee, from our city, unless you return into our creed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:89: We should have forged against God a lie if we returned into your creed; after God delivered us from it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:90: Said the Council of those of his people who disbelieved, ’Now, if you follow Shuaib, assuredly in that case you will be losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:91: So the earthquake seized them, and morning found them in their habitation fallen prostrate,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:92: those who cried lies to Shuaib, as if never they dwelt there; those who cried lies to Shuaib, they were the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:93: So he turned his back on them, and said, ’O my people, I have delivered to you the Messages of my Lord, and advised you sincerely; how should I grieve for a people of unbelievers?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:94: We have sent no Prophet to any city but that We seized its people with misery and hardship, that haply they might be humble;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:95: then We gave them in the place of evil good, till they multiplied, and said, ’Hardship and happiness visited our fathers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:96: Yet had the peoples of the cities believed and been godfearing, We would have opened upon them blessings from heaven and earth; but they cried lies, and so We seized them for what they earned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:97: Do the people of the cities feel secure Our might shall not come upon them at night while they are sleeping?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:98: Do the people of the cities feel secure Our might shall not come upon them in daylight while they are playing?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:99: Do they feel secure against God’s devising? None feels secure against God’s devising but the people of the lost.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:100: Is it not a guidance to those who inherit the earth after those who inhabited it that, did We will, We would smite them because of their sins, sealing their hearts so they do not hear?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:101: Those cities We relate to thee tidings of; their Messengers came to them with the clear signs, but they were not the ones to believe in that they had cried lies before; so God seals the hearts of the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:102: We found no covenant in the most part of them; indeed, We found the most part of them ungodly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:103: Then We sent, after them, Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his Council, but they did them wrong; so behold thou, how was the end of the workers of corruption!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:104: Moses said, ’Pharaoh, I am a Messenger from the Lord of all Being,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:105: worthy to say nothing regarding God except the truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:106: Said he, ’If thou hast brought a sign, produce it, if thou speakest truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:107: So he cast his staff; and behold, it was a serpent manifest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:108: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it was white to the beholders.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:109: Said the Council of the people of Pharaoh, ’Surely this man is a cunning sorcerer
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:110: who desires to expel you from your land; what do you command?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:111: They said, ’Put him and his brother off a while, and send among the cities musterers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:112: to bring thee every cunning sorcerer.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:113: And the sorcerers came to Pharaoh, saying, ’We shall surely have a wage, if we should be the victors?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:114: He said, ’Yes, indeed; and you shall be among the near-stationed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:115: They said, ’Moses, wilt thou cast, or shall we be the casters?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:117: And We revealed to Moses: ’Cast thy staff!’ And lo, it forthwith swallowed up their lying invention.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:118: So the truth came to pass, and false was proved what they were doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:119: So they were vanquished there, and they turned about, humbled.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:120: And the sorcerers were cast down, bowing themselves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:121: They said, ’We believe in the Lord of all Being,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:122: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:123: Said Pharaoh, ’You have believed in Him before I gave you leave.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:124: I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you all together.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:125: They said, ’Surely unto our Lord we are turning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:126: Thou takest vengeance upon us only because we have believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:127: Then said the Council of the people of Pharaoh, ’Wilt thou leave Moses and his people to work corruption in the land, and leave thee and thy gods?’ Said he, ’We shall slaughter their sons and spare their women; surely we are triumphant over them!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:128: Said Moses to his people, ’Pray for succour to God, and be patient; surely the earth is God’s and He bequeaths it to whom He will among His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:129: They said, ’We have been hurt before thou camest to us, and after thou camest to us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:130: Then seized We Pharaoh’s people with years of dearth, and scarcity of fruits, that haply they might remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:131: So, when good came to them, they said, ’This belongs to us’; but if any evil smote them, they would augur ill by Moses and those with him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:132: And they said, ’Whatsoever sign thou bringest to us, to cast a spell upon us, we will not believe thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:133: So We let loose upon them the flood and the locusts, the lice and the frogs, the blood, distinct signs; but they waxed proud and were a sinful people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:134: And when the wrath fell upon them, they said, ’Moses, pray to thy Lord for us by the covenant He has made with thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:135: But when We removed from them the wrath unto a term that they should come to, lo, they broke their troth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:136: So We took vengeance on them, and drowned them in the sea, for that they cried lies to Our signs and heeded them not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:137: And We bequeathed upon the people that were abased all the east and the west of the land We had blessed; and perfectly was fulfilled the most fair word of thy Lord upon the Children of Israel, for that they endured patiently; and We destroyed utterly the works of Pharaoh and his people, and what they had been building.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:138: And We brought the Children of Israel over the sea, and they came upon a people cleaving to idols they had.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:139: Surely this they are engaged upon shall be shattered, and void is what they have been doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:140: He said, ’What, shall I seek a god for you other than God, who has preferred you above all beings?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:141: And when We delivered you from the folk of Pharaoh who were visiting you with evil chastisement, slaying your sons, and sparing your women -- and in that was a grievous trial from your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:142: And We appointed with Moses thirty nights and We completed them with ten, so the appointed time of his Lord was forty nights; and Moses said to his brother Aaron, ’Be my successor among my people, and put things right, and do not follow the way of the workers of corruption.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:143: And when Moses came to Our appointed time and his Lord spoke with him, he said, ’Oh my Lord, show me, that I may behold Thee!’ Said He, ’Thou shalt not see Me; but behold the mountain -- if it stays fast in its place, then thou shalt see Me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:144: Said He, ’Moses, I have chosen thee above all men for My Messages and My Utterance; take what I have given thee, and be of the thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:145: And We wrote for him on the Tablets of everything an admonition, and a distinguishing of everything: ’So take it forcefully, and command thy people to take the fairest of it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:146: I shall turn from My signs those who wax proud in the earth unjustly; though they see every sign, they will not believe in it, and though they see the way of rectitude they will not take it for a way, and though they see the way of error, they will take it for a way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:147: Those who cry lies to Our signs, and the encounter in the world to come -- their works have failed; shall they be recompensed, except according to the things they have done?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:148: And the people of Moses took to them, after him, of their ornaments a Calf -- a mere body that lowed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:149: And when they smote their hands, and saw that they had gone astray, they said, ’If our Lord has not mercy on us, and forgives us not, surely we shall be of the lost.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:150: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and sorrowful, he said, ’Evilly have you done in my place, after me; what, have you outstripped your Lord’s commandment?’ And he cast down the Tablets, and laid hold of his brother’s head, dragging him to him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:151: He said, ’O my Lord, forgive me and my brother and enter us into Thy mercy; Thou art the most merciful of the merciful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:152: ’Surely those who took to themselves the Calf -- anger shall overtake them from their Lord, and abasement in this present life; so We recompense those who are forgers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:153: And those who do evil deeds, then repent thereafter and believe, surely thereafter thy Lord is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:154: And when Moses’ anger abated in him, he took the Tablets and in the inscription of them was guidance, and mercy unto all those who hold their Lord in awe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:155: And Moses chose of his people seventy men for Our appointed time; and when the earthquake seized them, he said, ’My Lord, hadst Thou willed Thou wouldst have destroyed them before, and me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:156: And prescribe for us in this world good, and in the world to come; we have repented unto Thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:157: those who follow the Messenger, ’the Prophet of the common folk, whom they find written down with them in the Torah and the Gospel, bidding them to honour, and forbidding them dishonour, making lawful for them the good things and making unlawful for them the corrupt things, and relieving them of their loads, and the fetters that were upon them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:158: Say: ’O mankind, I am the Messenger of God to you all, of Him to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:159: Of the people of Moses there is a nation who guide by the truth, and by it act with justice.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:160: And We cut them up into twelve tribes, nations.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:161: And when it was said to them, ’Dwell in this township and eat of it wherever you will; and say, Unburdening; and enter in at the gate, prostrating; We will forgive you your transgressions, and increase the good-doers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:162: Then the evildoers of them substituted a saying other than that which had been said to them; so We sent down upon them wrath out of heaven for their evildoing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:163: And question them concerning the township which was bordering the sea, when they transgressed the Sabbath, when their fish came to them on the day of their Sabbath, swimming shorewards, but on the day they kept not Sabbath, they came not unto them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:164: And when a certain nation of them said, ’Why do you admonish a people God is about to destroy or to chastise with a terrible chastisement?’ They said, ’As an excuse to your Lord; and haply they will be godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:165: So, when they forgot that they were reminded of; We delivered those who were forbidding wickedness, and We seized the evildoers with evil chastisement for their ungodliness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:166: And when they turned in disdain from that forbidding We said to them, ’Be you apes, miserably slinking!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:167: And when Thy Lord proclaimed He would send forth against them, unto the Day of Resurrection, those who should visit them with evil chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:168: And We cut them up into nations in the earth, some of them righteous, and some of them otherwise; and We tried them with good things and evil, that haply they should return.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:169: And there succeeded after them a succession who inherited the Book, taking the chance goods of this lower world, and saying, ’It will be forgiven us’; and if chance goods the like of them come to them, they will take them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:170: And those who hold fast to the Book, and perform the prayer -- surely We leave not to waste the wage of those who set aright.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:171: And when We shook the mountain above them as if it were a canopy, and they supposed it was about to fall on them: ’Take forcefully what We have given you, and remember what is in it; haply you will be godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:172: And when thy Lord took from the Children of Adam, from their loins, their seed, and made them testify touching themselves, ’Am I not your Lord?’ They said, ’Yes, we testify’-- lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, ’As for us, we were heedless of this,’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:173: or lest you say, ’Our fathers were idolaters aforetime, and we were seed after them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:174: So We distinguish the signs; and haply they will return.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:175: And recite to them the tiding of him to whom We gave Our signs, but he cast them off; and Satan followed after him, and he became one of the perverts.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:176: And had We willed, We would have raised him up thereby; but he inclined towards the earth and followed his lust.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:177: An evil likeness is the likeness of the people who cried lies to Our signs, and themselves were wronging.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:178: Whomsoever God guides, he is rightly guided; and whom He leads astray -- they are the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:179: We have created for Gehenna many jinn and men: they have hearts, but understand not with them; they have eyes, but perceive not with them; they have ears, but they hear not with them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:180: To God belong the Names Most Beautiful; so call Him by them, and leave those who blaspheme His Names -- they shall assuredly be recompensed for the things they did.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:181: Of those We created are a nation who guide by the truth, and by it act with justice.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:182: And those who cry lies to Our signs We will draw them on little by little whence they know not;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:183: and I respite them -- assuredly My guile is sure.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:184: Have they not reflected? No madness is in their comrade; he is naught but a plain warner.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:185: Or have they not considered the dominion of the heaven and of the earth, and what things God has created, and that it may be their term is already nigh? In what manner of discourse then will they after this believe?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:186: Whomsoever God leads astray, no guide he has; He leaves them in their insolence blindly wandering.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:187: They will question thee concerning the Hour, when it shall berth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:188: Say: ’I have no power to profit for myself; or hurt, but as God will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:189: It is He who created you out of one living soul, and made of him his spouse that he might rest in her.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:190: Thereafter, when He gave them a righteous son, they assigned Him associates in that He had given them; but God is high exalted above that they associate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:191: What, do they associate that which creates nothing and themselves are created,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:192: and that have no power to help them, neither they help themselves?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:193: If you call them to guidance they will not follow you; equal it is to you whether you call them, or whether you are silent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:194: Those on whom you call apart from God, are servants the likes of you; call them and let them answer you, if you speak truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:195: What, have they feet wherewith they walk, or have they hands wherewith they lay hold, or have they eyes wherewith they see, or have they ears wherewith they give ear? Say: ’Call you then to your associates; then try your guile on me, and give me no respite.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:196: My Protector is God who sent down the Book, and He takes into His protection the righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:197: And those on whom you call, apart from God, have no power to help you, neither they help themselves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:198: If you call them to the guidance they do not hear; and thou seest them looking at thee, unperceiving.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:199: Take the abundance, and bid to what is honourable, and turn away from the ignorant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:200: If a provocation from Satan should provoke thee, seek refuge in God; He is All-hearing, All-seeing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:201: The godfearing, when a visitation of Satan troubles them, remember, and then see clearly;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:202: and their brothers they lead on into error, then they stop not short.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:203: And when thou bringest them not a sign, they say, ’Why hast thou not chosen one?’ Say: ’I follow only what is revealed to me from my Lord; this is clear testimony from your Lord, guidance, and mercy for a people of believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:204: And when the Koran is recited, give you ear to it and be silent; haply so you will find mercy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:205: Remember thy Lord in thy soul, humbly and fearfully, not loud of voice, at morn and eventide.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 7:206: Surely those who are with thy Lord wax not too proud to serve Him; they chant His praise, and to Him they bow.

Muhammad Asad.verse 7:2: A DIVINE WRIT has been bestowed from on high upon thee – and let there be no doubt about this in thy heart – in order that thou mayest warn [the erring] thereby, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:4: "Follow what has been sent down unto you by your Sustainer, and follow no masters other than Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:6: community have We destroyed, with Our punishment coming upon it by night, or while they were resting at noontide!
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:7: And when Our punishment came upon them, they had nothing to say for themselves, and could only cry, "Verily, we were wrongdoers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:8: Thus, [on Judgment Day] We shall most certainly call to account all those unto whom a
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:9: message was sent, and We shall most certainly call to account the message-bearers ;
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:10: and thereupon We shall most certainly reveal unto them Our knowledge [of their doings]: for never have We been absent [from them].
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:11: And true will be the weighing on that Day: and those whose weight [of good deeds] is heavy in the balance – it is they, they who shall attain to a happy state;
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:12: whereas those whose weight is light in the balance – it is they who will have squandered their own selves by their willful rejection of Our messages.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:13: YEA, INDEED, [O men,] We have given you a
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:14: place on earth, and appointed thereon means of livelihood for you:
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:16: Yea, indeed, We have created you, and then formed you; and then We said unto the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam!" – whereupon they
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:17: prostrated themselves, save Iblīs: he was not among those who prostrated themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:18: [And God] said: "What has kept thee from prostrating thyself when I commanded thee?" Answered :
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:19: "I am better than he: Thou hast created me out of fire, whereas him Thou hast created out of clay.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:21: said: "Down with thee, then, from this
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:22: – for it is not meet for thee to show arrogance here! Go forth, then: verily, among the humiliated shalt thou be!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:24: "Grant me a respite till the Day when all shall be raised from the dead.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:25: [And God] replied: "Verily, thou shalt be among those who are granted a respite.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:26: [Whereupon Iblīs] said: "Now that Thou hast thwarted me, I shall most certainly lie in ambush for them all along Thy straight way,
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:27: and shall most certainly fall upon them openly as well as in a manner beyond their ken, and from their right and from their left: and most of them Thou wilt find ungrateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:28: [And God] said: "Go forth from here, disgraced and disowned!
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:29: as for such of them as follow thee – I will most certainly fill hell with you all!
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:30: And [as for thee], O Adam, dwell thou and thy wife in this garden, and eat, both of you, whatever you may wish; but do not approach this one tree, lest you become evildoers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:31: Thereupon Satan whispered unto the two with a view to making them conscious of their nakedness, of which
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:32: they had been unaware; and he said: "Your Sustainer has but forbidden you this tree lest you two become
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:33: angels, or lest you live forever.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:34: And he swore unto them, "Verily, I am of those who wish you well indeed!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:35: – and thus he led them on with deluding thoughts.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:36: The two replied: "O our Sustainer! We have sinned against ourselves – and unless Thou grant us forgiveness and bestow Thy mercy upon us, we shall most certainly be lost!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:37: Said He: "Down with you, [and be henceforth] enemies unto one another, having on earth your abode and livelihood for a while:
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:38: there shall you live" – He added – "and there shall you die, and thence shall you be brought forth [on Resurrection Day]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:39: O CHILDREN of Adam! Indeed, We have bestowed upon you from on high [the knowledge of making] garments to cover your nakedness, and as a thing of beauty: but the garment of God-consciousness is the best of all.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:40: O children of Adam! Do not allow Satan to seduce you in the same way as he caused your ancestors to be driven out of the garden: he deprived them of their garment [of God-consciousness] in order to make them aware of their nakedness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:43: whenever they commit a shameful deed, they are wont to say, "We found our forefathers doing it" and "God has enjoined it upon us.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:45: enjoined the doing of what is right; and [He desires you to] put your whole being into every act of worship, and to call unto Him, sincere in your faith in Him alone.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:46: some [of you] He will have graced with His guidance, whereas for some a straying from the right path will have become unavoidable: for, behold, they will have taken [their own] evil impulses for their masters in preference to God, thinking all the while that they have found the right path!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:47: O CHILDREN of Adam! Beautify yourselves for every act of worship, and eat and drink ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:48: but do not waste: verily, He does not love the wasteful!
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:49: Say: "Who is there to forbid the beauty which God has brought forth for His creatures, and the good things from among the means of sustenance?" Say: "They are
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:50: in the life of this world unto all who have attained to faith – to be theirs alone on Resurrection Day.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:52: Say: "Verily, my Sustainer has forbidden only shameful deeds, be they open or secret, and [every kind of] sinning, and unjustified envy, and the ascribing of divinity to aught beside Him – since He has never bestowed any warrant therefor from on high – and the attributing unto God of aught of which you have no knowledge.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:53: And for all people a term has been set: and when [the end of] their term approaches, they can neither delay it by a single moment, nor can they hasten it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:54: O CHILDREN of Adam! Whenever there come unto you apostles of your own, conveying My messages unto you, then all who are conscious of Me and live righteously – no fear need they have, and neither shall they grieve;
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:55: but they who give the lie to Our messages and scorn them in their pride – these are destined for the fire, therein to abide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:56: And who could be more wicked than they who attribute their own lying inventions to God or give the lie to His messages? Whatever has been decreed to be their lot [in life] will be theirs – till there shall come unto them Our messengers to cause them to die,
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:57: shall say, "Where, now, are those beings whom you were wont to invoke beside God?" And [those sinners] will reply, "They have forsaken us!" – and
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:58: they will bear witness against themselves that they had been denying the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:59: [And God] will say: "Join those hosts of invisible beings and humans who have gone before you into the fire!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:60: every time a host enters [the fire], it will curse its fellow-host – so much so that, when they all shall have passed into it, one after another, the last of them will speak
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:61: of the first of them: "O our, Sustainer! It is they who have led us astray: give them, therefore, double suffering through fire!" He will reply: "Every one of you deserves double suffering – but you know it not.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:62: And the first of them will say unto the last of them: "So you were in no wise superior to us! Taste, then, this suffering for all [the evil] that you were wont to do!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:63: VERILY, unto those who give the lie to Our messages and scorn them in their pride, the gates of heaven shall not be opened; and they shall not enter paradise any more than a twisted rope can pass through a needle’s eye: for thus do We requite such as are lost in sin.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:64: Hell will be their resting-place and their covering as well: for thus do We requite the evildoers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:65: But those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds –
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:66: We do not burden any human being with more than he is well able to bear – they are destined for paradise, therein to abide,
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:67: after We shall have removed whatever unworthy thoughts or feelings may have been
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:69: And the inmates of paradise will call out to the inmates of the fire: "Now we have found that what our Sustainer promised us has come true; have you, too, found that what your Sustainer promised you has come true?" [The others] will answer, "Yes!" – whereupon from their midst a voice will loudly proclaim: "God’s rejection is the due of the evildoers
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:70: who turn others away from God’s path and try to make it appear crooked, and who refuse to acknowledge the truth of the life to come!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:71: And between the two there will be a barrier.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:72: And whenever their eyes are turned towards the inmates of the fire, they will cry: "O our Sustainer! Place us not among the people who have been guilty of evildoing!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:73: And they who [in life] had possessed this faculty of discernment will call out to those whom they recognize by their marks [as sinners], saying: "What has your amassing [of wealth] availed you, and all the false pride of your past?
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:74: Are those [blessed ones] the self-same people of whom you once solemnly declared, ‘Never will God bestow His grace upon them’? [For now they have been told,] ‘Enter paradise; no fear need you have, and neither shall you grieve!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:75: And the inmates of the fire will call out unto the inmates of paradise: "Pour some water upon us, or some of the sustenance [of paradise] which God has provided for you!" [The inmates of paradise] will reply: "Verily, God has denied both to those who have denied the truth –
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:76: those who, beguiled by the life of this world, have made play and passing delights their religion!" [And God will say:] "And so We shall be oblivious of them today as they were oblivious of the coming of this their Day [of Judgment], and as Our messages they did deny:
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:77: for, indeed, We did convey unto them a divine writ which We clearly, and wisely, spelled out – a guidance and a grace unto people who will believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:78: Are [the unbelievers] but waiting for the final meaning of that [Day of Judgment] to unfold?
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:79: on the Day when its final meaning is unfolded, those who aforetime had been oblivious thereof will say: "Our Sustainer’s apostles have indeed told us the truth! Have we, then, any intercessors who could intercede in our behalf? Or could we be brought back [to life] so that we might act otherwise than we were wont to act?" Indeed, they will have squandered their own selves, and all their false imagery will have forsaken them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:80: VERILY, your Sustainer is God, who has created the heavens and the earth in six aeons, and is established on the throne of His almightiness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:81: Call unto your Sustainer humbly, and in the secrecy of your hearts.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:82: hence, do not spread corruption on earth after it has been so well ordered.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:83: And He it is who sends forth the winds as a glad tiding of His coming grace – so that, when they have brought heavy clouds, We may drive them towards dead land and cause thereby water to descend; and by this means do We cause all manner of fruit to come forth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:84: As for the good land, its vegetation comes forth [in abundance] by its Sustainer’s leave, whereas from the bad it comes forth but poorly.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:85: INDEED, We sent forth Noah unto his people, and he said: "O my people! Worship God alone: you have no deity other than Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:86: The great ones among his people replied: "Verily, we see that thou art obviously lost in error!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:88: "O my people! There is no error in me, but I am an apostle from the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:89: I am delivering unto you my Sustainer’s messages and giving you good advice: for I know [through revelation] from God what you do not know.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:90: Why, do you deem it strange that a tiding from your Sustainer should have come unto you through a man from among yourselves, so that he might warn you, and that you might become conscious of God, and that you might be graced with His mercy?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:91: And yet they gave him the lie! And so We saved him and those who stood by him, in the ark, the while We caused those who had given the lie to Our messages to drown: verily, they were blind folk!
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:92: AND UNTO [the tribe of] ’ād [We sent] their brother Hūd.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:93: Said the great ones among his people, who refused to acknowledge the truth: "Verily, we see that thou art weak-minded; and, verily, we think that thou art a liar!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:95: "O my people! There is no weak-mindedness in me, but I am an apostle from the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:96: I am delivering unto you my Sustainer’s messages and advising you truly and well.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:97: Why, do you deem it strange that a tiding from your Sustainer should have come unto you through a man from among yourselves, so that he might warn you? Do but remember how He made you heirs to Noah’s people, and endowed you abundantly with power: remember, then, God’s blessings, so that you might attain to a happy state!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:98: They answered: "Hast thou come to us [with the demand] that we worship God alone, and give up all that our forefathers were wont to worship? Bring about, then, that
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:99: with which thou hast threatened us, if thou art a man of truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:101: "You are already beset by loathsome evil and by your Sustainer’s condemnation! Do you argue with me about the
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:102: names which you have invented – you and your forefathers – for which God has bestowed no warrant from on high? Wait, then, [for what will happen:] verily, I shall wait with you!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:103: And so, by Our grace, We saved him and those who stood by him, the while We wiped out the last remnant of those who gave the lie to Our messages and would not believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:104: AND UNTO [the tribe of] Thamūd [We sent] their brother Sālih.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:105: "And remember how He made you heirs to [the tribe of] ’ād and settled you firmly on earth, so that you [are able to] build for yourselves castles on its plains and hew out mountains [to serve you] as dwellings: remember, then, God’s blessings, and do not act wickedly on earth by spreading corruption.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:106: The great ones among his people, who gloried in their arrogance towards all who were weak, said unto the believers among them: "Do you
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:107: know that Sālih has been sent by his Sustainer?" They answered "Verily, we believe in the message which he bears.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:109: the arrogant ones said: "Behold, what you have come to believe in we refuse to regard as true!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:110: And then they cruelly slaughtered the she-camel, and turned with disdain from their Sustainer’s commandment, and said: "O Sālih! Bring about that
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:111: with which thou hast threatened us, if thou art truly one of God’s message-bearers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:112: Thereupon an earthquake overtook them: and then they lay lifeless, in their very homes, on the ground.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:114: turned away from them, and said: "O my people! Indeed, I delivered unto you my Sustainer’s message and gave you good advice: but you did not love those who gave
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:117: Lot, when he said unto his people: "Will you commit abominations such as none in all the world has ever done before you?
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:118: Verily, with lust you approach men instead of women: nay, but you are people given to excesses!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:119: But his people’s only answer was this: "Expel them from your land! Verily, they are folk who make themselves out to be pure!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:120: Thereupon We saved him and his household – except his wife, who was among those that stayed behind –
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:121: the while We rained a rain [of destruction] upon the others: and behold what happened in the end to those people lost in sin!
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:122: AND UNTO [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu’ayb.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:123: this is for your own good, if you would but believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:124: And do not lie in ambush by every road [that leads to the truth], threatening and trying to turn away from God’s path all who believe in Him, and trying to make it appear crooked.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:125: He made you many: and behold what happened in the end to the spreaders of corruption!
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:126: "And if there be some among you who have come to believe in the message which I bear, the while the others do not believe, then have patience in adversity till God shall judge between us [and them]: for He is the best of all judges!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:127: Said the great ones among his people, who gloried in their arrogance: "Most certainly, O Shu’ayb, we shall expel thee and thy fellow-believers from our land, unless you indeed return to our ways!" Said :
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:129: We should be guilty of blaspheming against God were we to return to your ways after God has saved us from them! It is not conceivable that we should return to them – unless God, our Sustainer, so wills.
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:130: But the great ones among his people, who were bent on denying the truth, said [to his followers]: "Indeed, if you follow Shu’ayb, you will, verily, be the losers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:131: Thereupon an earthquake overtook them: and then they lay lifeless, in their very homes, on the ground –
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:132: they who had given the lie to Shu’ayb – as though they had never lived there: they who had given the lie to Shu’ayb – it was they who were the losers!
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:133: And he turned away from them, and said: "O my people! Indeed, I delivered unto you my Sustainer’s message and gave you good advice: how, then, could I mourn for people who have denied the truth?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:134: AND NEVER YET have We sent a prophet unto any community without trying its people with misfortune and hardship, so that they might humble themselves;
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:135: then We transformed the affliction into ease of life, so that they throve and said [to themselves], "Misfortune and hardship befell our forefathers as well" – whereupon We took them to task, all of a sudden, without their being aware [of what was coming].
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:136: Yet if the people of those communities had but attained to faith and been conscious of Us, We would indeed have opened up for them blessings out of heaven and earth: but they gave the lie to the truth – and so We took them to task through what they
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:138: Can, then, the people of any community ever feel secure that Our punishment will not come upon them by night, while they are asleep?
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:139: Why, can the people of any community ever feel secure that Our punishment will not come upon them in broad daylight, while they are engaged in
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:141: Can they, then, ever feel secure from God’s deep devising? But none feels secure from God’s deep devising save people who are
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:143: Has it, then, not become obvious unto those who have inherited the earth in the wake of former generations that, if We so willed, We could smite them
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:144: by means of their sins, sealing their hearts so that they cannot hear [the truth]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 7:146: communities – some of whose stories We

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:12: Allah said, “What has prevented you from prostrating when I ordered you?” He said, “I am better than him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:13: He said, “Then, get you down from here, it is not for you to show arrogance here.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:14: He said, “Then give me respite until a day when all will be resurrected.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:16: He said, “Now that You have led me astray, I will certainly sit for them (in ambush) on Your straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:17: Then I will come upon them from their front side and from their behind, and from their right and from their left.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:18: He (Allah) said, “Get out of here, condemned, rejected.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:19: O ’Ādam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise, and eat from wherever you like, but do not go near this tree, otherwise you shall join the transgressors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:20: Then Satan whispered to them, so that he might expose to them their shame that was hidden from them; and said, “Your Lord has not prohibited this tree for you, but to avoid your becoming angels or your becoming eternal.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:21: He swore an oath, “I am one of your well-wishers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:22: Thus, he cast both of them down by deception.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:23: They said, “Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and do not bless us with mercy, we shall, indeed, be among the losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:24: He said, “Go down, some of you enemies of some; and for you on the earth there will be a dwelling place and enjoyment for a time.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:25: (Further) He said, “There you shall live and there you shall die, and from there you shall be raised again.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:26: O children of ’Ādam, We have sent down to you the dress that covers your shame and provides adornment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:27: O children of ’Ādam, “Do not let Satan put you in trouble the way he had your parents expelled from Paradise, having their dress removed from them, so that he could show them their shame.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:28: When they do a shameful act, they say, “We have found our fathers doing it, and Allah has ordered us to do so.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:29: Say, “My Lord has ordered me to do justice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:30: He has led a group to guidance; and established for another group is misguidance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:31: O children of ’Ādam, take on your adornment at every mosque.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:32: Say, “Who has prohibited the adornment Allah has brought forth for His servants, and the wholesome things of sustenance?”Say, “They are for the believers during this worldly life (though shared by others), while they are purely for them on the day of Resurrection.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:33: Say, “My Lord has prohibited only the shameful acts, whether open or secret, and (every) sinful act, and unjust aggression, and that you associate with Allah anything for which He has not sent any authority, and that you attribute to Allah any thing about which you do not have sure knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:34: For every people there is an appointed time.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:35: O children of ’Ādam, if messengers from among you come to you conveying My verses to you, then, those who fear Allah and correct themselves will have no fear, nor shall they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:36: Those who reject Our verses and stand arrogant against them, - they are the inmates of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:37: So, who is more unjust than the one who coins a lie against Allah or rejects His signs? They shall receive their share from that (sustenance) which is written (for them in their destiny) until, when Our envoys (angels) shall come to them to take their souls away, they (the angels) will say, “Where are those (so-called gods) whom you used to invoke besides Allah?” They (the unbelievers) will say, “They all have vanished from us”, and they shall testify against themselves that they were unbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:38: He (Allah) will say, “Enter the Fire along with the peoples who passed before you from the Jinn and the human beings.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:39: The former ones will say to the latter ones, “So, you have no privilege against us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:40: Surely, those who have rejected Our signs and stood arrogant against them, the gates of the heavens shall not be opened for them, and they shall not enter Paradise unless a camel passes through the eye of a needle.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:41: For them there is a bed from the Jahannam, and over them there are coverings.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:42: Those who believe and do good deeds,-We do not obligate anyone beyond his capacity-they are the people of Paradise; they shall remain there for ever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:43: We will remove whatever amount of malice they had in their hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:44: The inmates of Paradise will call out to the inmates of the Fire: “We have found true what our Lord had promised to us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:45: who used to turn themselves away from the way of Allah, seeking to make it crooked, while they were the deniers of the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:46: Between the two groups there will be a barrier.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:47: When their eyes will be turned to the people of the Fire, they will say, “Our Lord, do not join us with the unjust people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:48: The people of A‘rāf will call out to the people (of Fire) whom they will recognize through their signs: “Your masses were not of any help to you, nor was the arrogance you used to show.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:49: Is it these (people of Paradise) about whom you swore that Allah would not allow His mercy to reach them?” (It will be said to such people,) “Enter Paradise; there will be no fear for you, nor shall you grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:50: The people of the Fire will call out to the people of Paradise, “Pour on us some water, or some of what Allah has provided you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:51: who had taken their faith as play and a game, and the worldly life had deceived them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:52: Surely We have brought them a book that We have elaborated with knowledge, as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:53: They are waiting for nothing but its final result (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:54: Surely, your Lord is Allah who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then He positioned himself on the Throne.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:55: Supplicate to your Lord humbly and secretly.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:56: Do not make mischief on the earth after it has been set in order.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:57: He is the One who sends the winds carrying good news before His blessings, until when they lift up the heavy clouds, We drive them to a dead land.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:58: As for a good land, its vegetation comes out with the permission of its Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:59: Surely We sent NūH to his people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:60: The chiefs of his people said, “Indeed we see you in an obvious error.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:61: He said, “O my people, there is no error in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:62: I convey to you the messages of my Lord and wish your betterment, and I know from Allah what you do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:63: Do you wonder that an advice from your Lord has come to you through a man from among you, so that he may warn you and that you may fear Allah, and that you may be blessed with mercy?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:64: Then, they accused him of falsehood; so We saved him, and those with him in the Ark, and drowned those who rejected Our signs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:65: To ‘Ād, We sent their brother Hūd.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:66: Said the chiefs of his people who disbelieved, “Indeed, we see you in folly, and we believe you are one of the liars.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:67: He said, “O my people, there is no folly in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:68: I convey to you the messages of my Lord; and I am an honest well-wisher for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:69: Do you wonder that an advice from your Lord has come to you through a man from among you, so that he may warn you? And remember when He made you successors after the people of NūH and gave you increased strength in physique.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:70: They said, “Have you come to us that we should worship Allah alone and give up what our fathers used to worship? Now, bring upon us that (scourge) with which you threaten us if you are one of the truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:71: He said, “The punishment and the anger from your Lord have fallen upon you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:72: So, We saved him and those with him out of mercy from Us, and We eradicated those who rejected Our signs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:73: To Thamūd, (We sent) their brother, SāliH.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:74: Remember when He made you successors after ‘Ād and lodged you on earth (whereby) you make castles in its plains and hew out the mountains to build houses.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:75: The haughty chiefs of his people said to those of the oppressed who had believed (in the Messenger), “Do you know for sure that SāliH is a messenger from his Lord?” They said, “Of course, we believe in what he has been sent with.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:76: The haughty people said, “As for us, we disbelieve in what you believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:77: Then they slaughtered the she-camel and defied the command of their Lord and said, “O SāliH, bring to us what you threaten us with, if you are one of the messengers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:78: So, the earthquake seized them, and they were (found dead) in their homes, fallen on their faces.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:79: So, he turned away from them and said, “O my people, indeed I have delivered to you the message of my Lord, and wished you betterment, but you do not like the well-wishers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:80: And (We sent) LūT (Lot) when he said to his people, “Do you commit the shameful act in which nobody in the world has ever preceded you?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:81: You come to men lustfully instead of women.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:82: The answer of his people was no other than to say, “Expel them from your town.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:83: So, We saved him and his family, except his wife.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:84: And We rained down upon them a rain.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:85: And to Madyan (We sent) their brother Shu‘aib.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:86: Do not sit in every path threatening and preventing from the way of Allah the people who believe in Him, and seeking a twist in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:87: If a group from among you has believed in what I have been sent with, and another group has not believed, then keep patience until Allah decides between us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:88: The chiefs of his people, who were arrogant, said, “O Shu‘aib, we will expel you and those who believe with you from our town, or you shall have to turn to our faith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:89: We will be forging a lie against Allah, if we were to turn to your faith after Allah has saved us from it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:90: The chiefs of his people who disbelieved said, “If you are to follow Shu‘aib, then you will be utter losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:91: So, the earthquake seized them, and they were (found dead) in their homes, fallen on their faces.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:92: Those who rejected Shu‘aib became as if they never dwelt there.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:93: So, he turned away from them and said, “O my people, I have surely delivered to you the message of my Lord, and wished your betterment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:94: We did not send any prophet to a town, but We seized its people with hardship and suffering, so that they may turn humble.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:95: Thereafter, We substituted good in place of evil until they increased, and said, “Hardship and prosperity came to our fathers (too).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:96: If the people of the towns believed and feared Allah, We would have opened for them blessings from the heavens and the earth, but they disbelieved.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:97: So, do the people of the towns feel themselves immune from Our punishment that may befall them at night while they are asleep?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:98: Or do the people of the towns feel themselves immune from Our punishment that may befall them in broad daylight while they are at play?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:99: Do they feel secure from Allah’s plan? None can feel secure from Allah’s plan except the people who are losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:100: Have all these events still not taught a lesson to those who inherit the land after its (former) inhabitants, that if We so willed, We could afflict them for their sins? But We seal their hearts, so that they do not listen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:101: Those are the towns We narrate to you their important events.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:102: We did not find with most of them any covenant (unbroken), and surely We have found most of them sinners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:103: After them, We sent Mūsā with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:104: Mūsā said, “O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of all the worlds;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:105: it befits me not to say anything about Allah except the truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:106: He said, “If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you are really truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:107: So he threw down his staff, and in no time it was a vivid serpent;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:108: and he drew out his hand, and it was luminous for the onlookers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:109: The chiefs of the people of Pharaoh said, “This man is certainly a sorcerer of great knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:110: He wants to expel you from your land.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:111: They said, “leave him and his brother alone for a while, and send (your) men to the cities to collect
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:112: and bring to you every expert sorcerer (who could defeat him).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:114: He said, “Yes, and of course, you will be among the closer ones (to me).
