Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:115: They said, “O Mūsā, would you throw (first) or are we to throw?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:117: We revealed to Mūsā, “Throw your staff.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:118: Thus the truth prevailed, and what they were doing became a nullity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:119: So, they were overcome then and there and turned humiliated.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:120: The sorcerers could not but fall in prostration.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:121: They said, “We believe in the Lord of the worlds,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:122: the Lord of Mūsā and Hārūn.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:123: Pharaoh said, “You have believed in him before my permission.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:124: I will cut off your hands and your legs from opposite sides.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:125: They said, “We have surely to return to our Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:126: For what fault would you punish us except that we have believed in the signs of our Lord when they appeared to us? O our Lord, pour out patience upon us, and cause us to die as Muslims (those who submit to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:127: The chiefs of the people of Pharaoh said, “Shall you leave Mūsā and his people free to spread disorder in the land and to abandon you and your gods?” He said, “We shall slaughter their sons and let their women remain alive.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:128: Mūsā said to his people, “Seek help from Allah and be patient.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:129: They said, “We were persecuted before you came to us and after you have come to us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:130: And We seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and poor production of fruits, so that they may learn a lesson.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:131: When good times came to them, they said, “This is our right.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:132: They said, “Whatever sign you bring to us to enchant us with, we are not going to believe in you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:133: So We sent upon them the storm and locusts and lice and frogs and blood, as signs distinct from each other.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:134: Whenever a scourge befell them, they said, “O Mūsā, pray for us to your Lord by the covenant He has made with you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:135: But when We removed the scourge from them for a term they had to reach, in no time they started to break their promise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:136: Then We subjected them to retribution, and drowned them in the sea, because they rejected Our signs, and were neglectful of them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:137: We caused those people who were deemed to be weak (the Israelites) to inherit the East and West of the land that We had blessed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:138: We made the children of Isrā’īl cross the sea, then they came across a people sitting in devotion before their idols.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:139: What these people are engaged in is sure to be destroyed; and false is what they are doing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:140: He said, “Shall I seek any one other than Allah as God for you, while He has given you excellence over the (people of all the) worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:141: (Remember) when We delivered you from the people of Pharaoh who inflicted grievous torment upon you, slaughtered your sons and left your women alive.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:142: And We made an appointment with Mūsā for thirty nights, then We supplemented them with another ten.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:143: When Mūsā came at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, “My Lord, show (Yourself) to me that I may look at You.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:144: He said, “Mūsā, I have chosen you above all men for my messages and for My speaking (to you).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:145: We wrote for him on the Tablets advice of every kind, and explanations of all (needful) things.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:146: I shall keep away from My verses those who show arrogance on the earth with no right to do so.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:147: Gone to waste are the deeds of those who have rejected Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:148: And in the absence of Mūsā, his people made a calf from their ornaments, which was merely a sculpture with a moaning sound.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:149: When they became remorseful and saw that they had gone astray, they said, “If Allah shows no mercy to us, and does not forgive us, we shall certainly be among the losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:150: When Mūsā returned to his people, angry and sad, he said, “How bad is the thing you have done in my absence! How did you act in haste against the command of your Lord?” He dropped down the Tablets, and grabbed the head of his brother, pulling him towards himself.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:151: He said, “My Lord! Forgive me and my brother, and admit us into Your mercy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:152: Surely, those who have taken the calf (as god) shall be seized by Allah’s wrath and by humiliation in the worldly life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:153: As for those who do evil, and repent thereafter, and embrace faith, your Lord is then most forgiving, very merciful (for them).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:154: When the fury of Mūsā calmed down, he picked up the Tablets, and in its contents there was guidance, and mercy for those who are fearful before their Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:155: And Mūsā selected seventy men from his people for Our appointment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:156: And write for us good in this world and in the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:157: those who follow the Messenger, the Ummiyy (unlettered) prophet whom they find written with them in the Torah and the Injīl , and who bids them what is fair and forbids what is unfair, and makes lawful for them good things, and makes unlawful for them impure things, and relieves them of their burden, and of the shackles that were upon them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:158: (O Prophet Muhammad) Say, “O people, I am a messenger of Allah (sent) to you from the One to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:159: Among the community of Mūsā there are people who guide with truth and do justice thereby.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:160: And We divided them into twelve tribes, as separate communities, and We revealed to Mūsā when his people asked him for water, “Strike the rock with your staff.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:161: (Recall) when it was said to them, “Live in this town and eat therefrom anywhere you like, and say, HiTTah (we seek forgiveness) and enter the gate prostrating yourselves, so that We forgive your errors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:162: But those of them who were unjust substituted another word for the one that was said to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:163: Ask them about the town situated by the sea, when they used to transgress in the matter of Sabbath, when their fish came to them openly on the Sabbath, and did not come when they did not have Sabbath.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:164: When a group of them said, “Why do you exhort a people whom Allah is going to destroy or chastise with a severe punishment?” They said, “To absolve ourselves before your Lord, and in order that they may fear Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:165: So, when they forgot the advice they were given, We saved those who used to forbid evil and seized those who transgressed with a bitter punishment, because they had been disobeying.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:166: When they persisted in doing what they were forbidden from, We said to them, “Become apes debased.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:167: Recall) when your Lord declared that He would surely keep sending, till the Day of Judgment, those who inflict on them evil chastisement.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:168: We divided them on the earth as separate communities.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:169: Then, after them, came a generation that inherited the Book, opting for the mundane stuff of this world and saying, “We shall be forgiven.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:170: Those who hold fast to the Book and establish Salāh, We shall never let the reward of (such) righteous people to go to waste.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:171: When We raised the mountain over them as though it were a canopy, and they thought it was falling upon them, (We said,) “Adhere firmly to what We have given you and remember what is therein, so that you may become God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:172: (Recall) when your Lord brought forth their progeny from the loins of the children of ’Ādam, and made them testify about themselves (by asking them,) “Am I not your Lord?” They said, “Of course, You are.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:173: or you should say, “It was our forefathers who associated partners with Allah, and we were their progeny after them; would you then destroy us on account of what the erroneous did?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:174: This is how We elaborate the verses, so that they may return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:175: Recite to them the story of the one whom We gave Our verses, then he wriggled out from them, so Satan pursued him and he became one of the perverted.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:176: If We so willed, We would have elevated him thereby; but he clung to the earth and followed his desires.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:177: Evil is the example of those who have rejected Our signs and have been doing wrong to themselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:178: The one whom Allah gives guidance is the one on the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:179: Surely We have created for Hell a lot of people from among Jinn and mankind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:180: For Allah there are the most beautiful names.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:181: Among those whom We have created there are people who guide with truth and do justice thereby.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:182: As for those who reject Our signs, We will lead them gradually (towards their punishment) in a way that they do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:184: Have they not reflected that their fellow (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:185: Have they not looked into the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and into the things Allah has created, and into the fact that their time might have possibly drawn near? In which other discourse, then, shall they believe after this?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:186: For those whom Allah lets go astray, there is no one to guide, and He leaves them wandering blindly in their rebellion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:187: They ask you about the Hour (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:188: Say, “I have no power to bring a benefit or a harm to myself, except that which Allah wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:189: He is the One who has created you from a single soul, and out of him created his wife, so that he may find comfort in her.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:190: But when We bless them with a perfect child, they ascribe partners to Him in what He blessed them with.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:191: Do they associate those with Allah who do not create any thing, rather, they are created (themselves)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:192: And they (the alleged partners) cannot extend to them any help, nor can they help themselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:193: If you call them to the right path, they will not follow you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:194: Surely, those whom you invoke beside Allah are slaves (of Allah) like you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:195: Do they have legs to walk with? Or do they have hands to grasp with? Or do they have eyes to see with or do they have ears to hear with? Say, “Call to your associate-gods, then, plot against me and allow me no respite.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:196: Surely, my protector is Allah who has revealed the Book and who does protect the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:197: Those whom you call beside Him cannot help you, nor can they help themselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:198: If you call them for guidance, they shall not hear.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:199: (O Prophet,) take forgiveness (as your habit), enjoin virtue, and ignore the ignorant.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:200: Should a stroke from the Satan strike you, seek refuge with Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:201: Surely when the God-fearing are touched by any instigation from Satan, they become conscious (of Allah), and at once they discern (the reality).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:202: As for the brethren of satans, they are dragged by them on into the error, and they do not desist.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:203: When you do not bring them a sign, they say, “Could you not make up one?”Say, “I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:204: When the Qur’ān is recited, listen to it and be silent, so that you may be blessed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:205: Remember your Lord in your heart with humility and awe, and without speaking loudly, in mornings and evenings, and do not be among the heedless.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 7:206: Surely, those who are with your Lord (i.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:2: A Book that is revealed to you; so let there be no inhibition in your breast because of it that you may warn thereby and as a reminder for those who believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:3: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord, and do not follow beside Him any patrons.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:4: How many a city have We destroyed! So Our might came upon it at night or while they slept at noon.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:5: And their only plea, when Our might came upon them, was to say, 'We were evildoers indeed'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:6: Then verily We shall question those to whom the Message was sent; and We shall question the messengers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:7: And We shall narrate to them with knowledge; for verily We were not absent.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:8: The weighing on that day, the true .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:9: As for those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:10: And as for those whose scales are light, those are the ones who have lost their souls, because they mistreated Our signs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:11: And We have given you power in the earth, and have appointed for you therein livelihoods; little thanks you show.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:12: And We created you, then shaped you, then said to the angels: ‘Prostrate yourselves before Adam!’ So they fell prostrate, all save Iblīs, he was not of those who make prostration.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:13: He said, ‘What prevented you from falling prostrate when I commanded you?’ He
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:15: Said He, 'Then go down from it - it is not for you to show pride here, so go forth! Surely you are among the abased!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:16: Said he, 'Reprieve me until the day when they are resurrected'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:17: Said He, 'Lo! You are of those reprieved'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:18: Said he, 'Now, because You have sent me astray verily I shall sit in ambush for them on Your straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:19: Then I shall come upon them from before them and from behind them and from their right and from their left.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:20: Said He, 'Go forth from it, degraded and banished.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:21: And, 'O Adam, dwell, you and your wife in the Garden, and eat from whence you will, but do not come near this tree, lest you become evildoers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:22: Then Satan whispered to them that he might manifest to them that which was hidden to them of their shameful parts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:23: And he swore to both of them, 'Truly, I am a sincere adviser to you'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:24: Thus did he lead them on by delusion; and when they tasted of the tree, their shameful parts were manifested to them, and they began to piece together onto themselves some of the leaves of the Garden.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:25: They said, 'Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we shall surely be among the lost'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:26: Said He, 'Go down, each of you, an enemy to the other.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:27: Said He, 'There you shall live, and there you shall die, and from there you shall be brought forth'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:28: O Children of Adam! We have sent down on you a garment to conceal your shameful parts, and feathers, and the garment of God-fearing, that is best; that is one of God's signs; perhaps they will remember.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:29: O Children of Adam! Let not Satan tempt you, as he caused your parents to go forth from the Garden, stripping them of their garments to manifest to them their shameful parts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:30: And when they commit any indecency they say, 'We found our fathers practising it, and God has enjoined it on us'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:32: A party, He has guided, while another party has deserved to go astray - they have taken devils as patrons instead of God, and think that they are guided'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:33: O Children of Adam! Don your adornment at every place of worship, and eat and drink, but do not be excessive; He truly does not love those who are excessive.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:34: Say, 'Who has forbidden the adornment of God which He has brought forth for His servants, and the good things of
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:35: sustenance?' Say: 'These, on the Day of Resurrection, shall be exclusively for those who believed during the life of this world.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:36: Say: 'My Lord forbids only indecencies, such of them as are apparent and such as are hidden, and sin, and wrongful insolence, and that you associate with God that for which He never revealed any warrant, and that you say concerning God that which you do not know'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:38: O Children of Adam! If there should come to you messengers from among you, narrating to you My signs, then whoever fears and makes amends, no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:39: And those who deny Our signs and scorn them, those shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, abiding therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:40: And who does greater evil than he who invents a lie against God, or denies His signs? Those - their portion of the Scripture shall reach them until, when Our messengers come to them, to take their souls, they say, 'Where is that which you were calling upon beside God?' They will say, 'They have gone astray from us'; and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:41: He will say, 'Enter into the Fire among communities of jinn and mankind who passed away before you'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:42: And the first of them shall say to the last of them, 'You have no advantage over us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:43: Those who deny Our signs and scorn them, indeed the gates of heaven shall not be opened for them, nor shall they enter Paradise until the camel passes through the eye of the needle.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:44: Hell shall be their bed, and over them coverings.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:45: And those who believe and perform righteous deeds We do not charge any soul beyond its scope, those are the inhabitants of Paradise, abiding therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:46: We shall strip away all rancour that is in their breasts; and beneath them flow rivers; and they will say, 'Praise be to God, Who guided us to this; for we would surely never have been guided if God had not guided us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:47: And the inhabitants of Paradise will call to the inhabitants of the Fire, 'We have found that which our Lord promised us to be true; have you found that which your Lord promised to be true?' They will say: 'Yes!' And then a crier shall proclaim between them, 'God's curse is on the evildoers,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:48: who bar from God's way desiring it, crooked, disbelieving in the Hereafter'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:49: And between them is a veil, and on the Heights are men, who know each by their mark and they call to the inhabitants of Paradise: 'Peace be upon you!' They have not entered it, although they aspire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:50: And when their eyes are turned towards the inhabitants of the Fire, they shall say, 'Our Lord, do not assign us with the evildoing folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:51: And those of the Heights call to men, whom they know by their mark, :
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:52: 'Your masses and your haughtiness have not availed you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:53: Are these the ones of whom you swore that God would never grant them mercy?', 'Enter Paradise; no fear shall come upon you, nor shall you grieve'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:54: And the inhabitants of the Fire call out to the inhabitants of Paradise :
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:55: 'Pour on us some water, or some of that which God has provided you!' They say: 'God has forbidden both to the disbelievers,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:56: those who took their religion for a diversion and a game, and whom the life of this world has deluded'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:57: And indeed We have brought them a Book, which We have detailed with knowledge, a guidance and a mercy for a people who believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:58: Are they waiting for anything but its fulfilment? On the day when its fulfilment comes, those who were forgetful of it before shall say, 'Indeed, our Lord's messengers came with the truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:59: Surely your Lord is God, Who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then presided upon the Throne.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:60: Call upon your Lord humbly and quietly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:61: And work not corruption in the land, after it has been set right, and call upon Him in fear, and in hope - surely the mercy of God is near to the virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:62: He it is Who sends the winds, unfolding with His mercy, until, when they bear heavy clouds, We lead it to a dead land, and then We send down thereon, and bring forth thereby, fruits of every kind.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:63: As for the good land, its vegetation comes forth by permission of its Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:64: Verily We sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people, worship God! You have no god other than Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:65: The council of his people said: 'Truly We see you in manifest error'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:66: He said, 'My people, there is no error in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:67: I convey to you the Messages of my Lord, and I am advising you, for I know from God what you know not.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:68: Do you then marvel that a reminder from your Lord should come to you through a man from among you, that he may warn you, and that you may fear, and that you might be shown mercy?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:69: But they denied him, and so We delivered him and those with him in the Ark, and We drowned those who denied Our signs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:71: The council, those of his people who disbelieved, said: 'We truly see you in folly, and we truly deem you of the liars'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:72: He said, 'O my people, there is no folly in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:73: I convey to you the Messages of my Lord, and I am your truthful adviser.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:74: Or do you marvel that a reminder from your Lord should come to you through a man from among you, that he may warn you? And remember when He made you vicegerents after the people of Noah, and increased your stature in extension.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:75: They said, 'Have you come to us that we should worship God alone, and forsake what our fathers worshipped? Then bring upon us what you promised us if you are of the truthful'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:76: He said, 'Already, terror and wrath from your Lord have fallen on you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:77: So We delivered him and those with him by a mercy from Us, and We cut the root of those who denied Our signs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:78: And to Thamūd their brother Sālih.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:79: And remember how He made you vicegerents after ‘ād, and gave you habitations in the land, making castles in its plains, and hewing its mountains into houses.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:80: Said the council of those of his people who waxed proud to those who were oppressed, to such of them as believed: ‘Are you aware that Sālih has been sent from his Lord?’ They said, ‘Truly we believe in the Message with which he has been sent’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:81: Said the ones who were proud, 'Truly we are disbelievers of that which you believe!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:82: So they hamstrung the she-camel and flouted the commandment of their Lord, and said, ‘O Sālih, bring upon us that which you promised us, if you are indeed a messenger’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:83: So the Trembling seized them, and they lay lifeless prostrate in their habitations.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:84: So he turned his back on them and said, 'O my people, I have conveyed to you the Message of my Lord and gave you sincere advice, but you do not love sincere advisers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:85: And Lot when he said to his people, 'Do you commit abomination, such as no one in all the worlds ever committed before you?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:86: Do you come lustfully to men instead of women? Nay, you are a wanton folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:87: And the response of his people was only that they said, 'Expel them from your city.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:88: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife: she was of those who stayed behind.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:89: And We rained upon them a rain.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:90: And to Midian their brother Shu‘ayb.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:91: And do not sit in every path, threatening and barring from God's way those who believe in Him and desiring that it be crooked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:92: And if there is a party of you who believe in that with which I have been sent, and a party who do not believe, then be patient until God judges between us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:93: Said the council of those of his people who were disdainful, ‘Surely we will expel you, O Shu‘ayb, and those who believe with you, from our city, unless you return to our creed’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:94: We would be forging a lie against God if we were to return to your creed, after God has delivered us from it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:95: Said the council of those of his people who disbelieved, ‘Verily if you follow Shu‘ayb, you shall indeed be losers’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:96: So the Trembling seized them, and they lay lifeless prostrate in their habitations.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:97: Those who denied Shu‘ayb — it is as if they had never dwelt there; those who denied Shu‘ayb, they were the losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:98: So he turned back on them, and said, 'O my people, I have conveyed to you the Messages of my Lord and advised you sincerely: so why should I grieve for a disbelieving people?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:99: And We did not send a prophet to any city but that We seized its people with misery and hardship so that they might be humble.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:100: Then We gave them in place of evil good, until they multiplied, and said, 'Hardship and happiness befell our fathers before'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:101: Yet had the people of the towns believed, and been fearful, We would have indeed opened upon them blessings from the heaven and earth, but they denied, and so We seized them on account of what they used to earn.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:102: Do the people of the towns feel secure from the coming of Our might upon them at night while they are sleeping?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:103: Or, do the people of the towns feel secure from the coming of Our might upon them in the daytime while they are playing?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:104: And so do they feel secure from God’s plotting? None feels secure from God’s plotting but the people who are losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:105: Has it not been shown to those who inherit the earth after those who inhabited it that if We will, We could smite them for their sins, and seal up their hearts so that they do not hear?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:106: Those towns We relate to you some of their tidings.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:107: And We did not find in most of them any covenant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:108: Then We sent, after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his council, but they mistreated them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:109: And Moses said, 'O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the World,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:110: One for whom it is right, to say nothing but the truth about God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:111: Said he, 'If you have come with a sign, then produce it, if you are of those who speak the truth'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:112: Then he cast down his staff and lo! it was a serpent, manifest [for all to see].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:113: And he drew forth his hand and lo! it was white for the beholders.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:114: The council of Pharaoh's folk said, 'Surely this man is a cunning sorcerer,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:115: who would expel you from your land.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:116: They said, 'Put him and his brother off a while, and send into the towns summoners,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:117: to bring you every cunning sorcerer' .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:118: And the sorcerers came to Pharaoh, saying, 'Surely there will be a wage for us if we are the victors?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:119: He said, 'Yes, and indeed you shall be of those brought near'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:120: They said, 'O Moses, either you cast, or we shall be the casters!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:121: He said, 'Cast!' And when they cast, they put a spell upon the people's eyes, and overawed them, and produced a mighty sorcery.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:124: Thus did the truth come to pass; and that which they were doing was proved false.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:125: Thus were they there defeated, becoming humiliated.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:126: And the sorcerers fell down in prostration.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:127: They said, 'We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:128: the Lord of Moses and Aaron'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:129: Pharaoh said, 'Have you believed in him before I gave you leave? Surely this is a plot you have plotted in the city that you may expel its people from it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:130: I shall assuredly have your hands and feet cut off on opposite sides then I shall have every one of you crucified'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:131: They said, 'Surely to our Lord we shall be restored.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:132: You are vindictive towards us only because we have believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:133: Then the council of Pharaoh's folk said, 'Will you leave Moses and his people to work corruption in the land, and flout you and your gods?' He said, 'We shall slaughter their sons and spare their women.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:135: Moses said to his people, 'Seek help in God and be patient.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:136: They said, 'We suffered harm before you came to us, and since you have come to us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:137: And verily We seized Pharaoh's folk with the years and dearth of fruits, so that they might remember.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:138: But whenever a good thing befell them, they said, 'This belongs to us'; and whenever an evil thing smote them, they would augur ill of Moses and those with him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:139: And they said, 'Whatever sign you bring us, to cast a spell upon us therewith, we will not believe in you'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:140: So We unleashed upon them the flood, and the locusts, and the lice; and the frogs; and the blood - distinct signs: but they were too scornful and were a sinful folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:141: And when the terror fell upon them, they said, 'O Moses, pray to your Lord for our sake by the covenant which He has made with you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:142: But when We removed the terror from them to a term which they should reach, lo! they were already reneging.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:143: So We exacted retribution from them and therefore We drowned them in the sea for that they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:144: And We bequeathed upon the people who were oppressed the eastern parts of the land and the western parts thereof which We had blessed, and the fair word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because they endured patiently; and We destroyed utterly what Pharaoh and his folk had been creating and what they had been erecting.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:145: And We brought the Children of Israel across the sea, and they came upon a people cleaving in devotion to idols they had.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:146: Truly as for these, their way will be destroyed and what they have been doing is in vain'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:147: He said, 'Shall I seek other than God as a god for you, when He has favoured you above all the worlds?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:148: And when We delivered you from Pharaoh's folk who were inflicting upon you terrible chastisement, slaying your sons and sparing your women; and therein was a tremendous trial from your Lord,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:149: And We appointed for Moses thirty nights, and completed them with ten.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:150: And when Moses came at Our appointed time, and his Lord spoke with him, he said, 'My Lord! Show me that I may behold You!' Said He, 'You shall not see Me, but behold the mountain, and if it remains, in its place, then you shall see Me'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:151: He said, 'O Moses, I have elected you from among mankind for My Messages and My Speech.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:152: And We inscribed for him in the Tablets about all things, as an admonition and a detailing of all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:154: I shall turn away from My signs those who behave arrogantly in the earth without right; and if they see every sign do not believe in it, and if they see the way of rectitude, do not adopt it as a way, and if they see the way of error, adopt it as a way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:155: Those who deny Our signs and the encounter in the Hereafter their works have failed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:156: And the people of Moses, after him made of their ornaments a calf, a
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:158: And when they became at a loss, and saw that they had gone astray, they said, 'Unless our Lord is merciful to us and forgives us, verily we shall be among the losers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:159: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and bitterly grieved, he said, 'Evil is that which you have followed in my place, after I had gone.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:160: He said, 'My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the Most Merciful of the merciful'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:161: 'Surely those who chose the calf - wrath and abasement shall come upon them from their Lord in the life of this world.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:162: But those who commit evil deeds and repent thereafter and believe - indeed your Lord thereafter is truly Forgiving, Merciful'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:163: And when Moses's anger abated, he took the Tablets, and in their copy, there was guidance, and mercy for all those who hold their Lord in awe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:164: And Moses chose of his people seventy men for Our appointed time; but when the Trembling seized them, he said, 'My Lord, had You willed You would have destroyed them long before, and me [with them].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:165: And prescribe for us in this world good and in the Hereafter.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:166: those who follow the Messenger, the uninstructed Prophet, whom they will find inscribed in their Torah and Gospel, enjoining them to decency and forbidding them indecency, making lawful for them the good things, and making unlawful for them the vile things, and relieving them of their burden, and the shackles that they used to bear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:167: Say: 'O mankind, I am the Messenger of God to you all, [the Messenger] of Him to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:168: And among the people of Moses there is a community who guide by the truth and act justly according to it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:169: And We divided them into twelve tribes communities.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:170: 'Strike the rock with your staff', and there gushed forth from it twelve fountains, each people now knew their drinking-place.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:171: And when it was said to them: 'Dwell in this city, and eat therein wherever you will, and say, "Exoneration", and enter the gate, prostrating.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:172: the evildoers among them substituted a saying other than that which had been said to them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:173: And question them about the city that was by the sea, how they would transgress the Sabbath, how their fish would come to them on the day of their Sabbath floating at the surface; but on the day they did not observe the Sabbath, they would not come to them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:174: And when a community among them said, 'Why do you preach
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:175: to a folk whom God is about to destroy or chastise with a severe chastisement?' They said, 'As an exculpation before your Lord; and so that they might be wary'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:176: And when they forgot that whereof they had been reminded, We delivered those who forbade evil, and seized those who did wrong with a grievous chastisement for their wickedness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:177: And when they disdained that which was prohibited to them, We said to them, 'Be apes, despised!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:178: And when your Lord proclaimed that He would send against them to the Day of Resurrection, those who would inflict on them grievous torment.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:179: And We divided them into communities in the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:180: And there succeeded after them a generation who inherited the Scripture, choosing the transient things of this inferior ,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:181: and saying, 'It will be forgiven us'; and yet if similar transient things were to come to them, they would take them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:182: And those who adhere to the Scripture, and have established prayer - verily We shall not let the wages of reformers go to waste.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:183: And when We wrenched the mountain above them, as if it were a canopy, and they thought that it was about to fall upon them: 'Take firmly what We have given you, and remember what is in it that you might be God-fearing'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:184: And when your Lord took from the Children of Adam, from their loins their seed and made them testify against themselves, 'Am I not your Lord?' They said, 'Yea, indeed we testify', lest they should say on the Day of Resurrection, 'Truly, of this we were unaware'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:185: Or lest you should say, 'It is merely that our fathers were idolaters before and we were descendants of theirs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:186: Thus We detail the signs and that they might revert.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:187: And recite to them the tidings of him to whom We gave Our signs, but he cast them off, and Satan pursued him, and he became of the perverse.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:188: And had We willed, We would have raised him up, thereby; but he was disposed to the earth, and followed his whims.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:189: Evil as an example are the people, who denied Our signs, and were wont to wrong themselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:190: He whom God guides, he is guided, and he whom He sends astray - truly they are the losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:191: And We have indeed urged unto Hell many of the jinn and mankind, having hearts wherewith they do not understand, and having eyes wherewith they do not perceive, and having ears wherewith they do not hear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:192: And to God belong the Most Beautiful Names - so invoke Him by them, and leave those who blaspheme His Names.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:193: And of those whom We created there is a community who guide by the truth, and act justly therewith.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:194: And those who deny Our signs, We will draw them on by degrees, whence they do not know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:195: And I will respite them - assuredly My scheme is strong.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:196: Have they not considered that there is no madness in their comrade? He is but a clear warner.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:197: And have they not reflected upon the dominion of the heaven and of the earth, and what things God has created, and that it may be that their term is already near? In what fact then after this will they believe?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:198: Whomever God sends astray, he has no guide.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:199: They will question you about the Hour when it shall come to pass.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:200: Say: 'I have no power to bring benefit myself, or hurt except as God wills.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:201: He, it is Who created you from a single soul, and made from him his spouse that he might take rest in her.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:202: But when He gave them a sound one, they ascribed to Him associates in that which He had given them; but exalted is God above what they associate.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:203: Do they associate those who cannot create anything, but are themselves created,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:204: and who are not able to give them any help, nor can they help themselves?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:205: And if you call them to guidance, they will not follow you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:206: for you, whether you call them, or whether you are silent.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:207: Truly those on whom you call besides God are servants like you; call them then and let them answer you, if you are truthful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:208: Have they feet wherewith they walk or, have they hands wherewith they can grasp or, have they eyes wherewith they can see or, have they ears wherewith they give ear? Say: 'Call upon your associates; then scheme against me, and waste no time.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:209: Truly my Protector is God Who reveals the Book, and He takes charge of the righteous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:210: And as for those on whom you call besides God, they have no power to help you, nor can they help themselves'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:211: And if you call upon them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them staring at you, but they do not perceive.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:213: with forgiveness, and enjoin kindness, and turn away from the ignorant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:214: And if any insinuation from Satan should provoke you, seek refuge in God, He is Hearing, Seeing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:215: Truly the God-fearing, when a visitation from Satan touches them, they remember, and then see clearly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:216: And their brothers, they lead them further into error, and do not stop short.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:217: And when you do not bring them a sign, they say, 'Why have you not chosen one?' Say: 'I follow only that which is revealed to me from my Lord; this is insight from your Lord, and a guidance and a mercy for a people who believe'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:218: And when the Qur’ān is recited, listen to it and pay heed so that you might find mercy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:219: And remember your Lord within yourself, humbly, and fearfully, and more quietly than speaking out loud at morning and evening.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 7:220: Surely those who are with your Lord are not too proud to worship Him; they glorify Him, and to Him they prostrate.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:2: (O Esteemed Beloved!) This is the Book (that) has been revealed to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:3: (O people!) Follow this (Qur’an) which has been sent down to you from your Lord, and do not follow (any heretic rulers and) friends other than Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:4: And how many a town (is such as) We destroyed! Our torment came upon them at night or (whilst) they were asleep at noon.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:5: And when Our torment came upon them, their cry was nothing (else) but they began to say: ‘No doubt we were the wrongdoers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:6: Then We shall certainly interrogate those to whom We sent Messengers, and We shall assuredly ask the Messengers as well (with regard to the response to their call for truth and their teaching and preaching).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:7: We shall then relate to them from (Our) knowledge (all their) affairs, and We were not absent (from anywhere, unable to monitor them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:8: And on that Day, the weighing (of deeds) is a truth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:9: But those whose scales (of righteous deeds) are light, it is they who have harmed their souls because they had been unjust to Our Revelations.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:10: And surely, We established you firmly on earth with control and authority and created therein means of sustenance for you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:11: And certainly, We did create you (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:12: (Allah) said: ‘(O Iblis!) What inhibited you that you did not prostrate yourself when I commanded you?’ He said: ‘I am better than he.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:13: (Allah) said: ‘So, get you down from here.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:14: He (Iblis) said: ‘Grant me respite (to live) till the Day when people will be raised up (from the graves).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:15: (Allah) said: ‘Indeed, you are of those granted respite.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:16: He (Iblis) said: ‘Since You have led me astray, (I swear that) I will (also) sit on Your straight path (to waylay the children of Adam till I cause them to deviate from the path of truth).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:17: I will assuredly approach them from their front, from their rear, from their right and from their left, and (consequently) You will not find most of them grateful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:18: Allah commanded: ‘(O Iblis!) Be gone from here, humiliated and cursed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:19: And, O Adam, reside (both) you and your wife in Paradise and eat from wherever you wish.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:20: But Satan created doubt in the hearts of both (Adam and Hawwa )
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:21: in order to make manifest to them their private parts which were hidden (from their eyes).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:22: your Lord has not forbidden you (eating fruit of) this tree, but (because, eating it,) you both will transform into angels (free from human characteristics), or both of you become (its) permanent residents (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:23: And he swore to both of them, saying: ‘I am indeed of your well-wishers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:24: So by means of deceit he tempted both of them down (into eating the fruit of the tree).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:25: Both of them submitted: ‘O our Lord! We have wronged our souls.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:26: (Allah) said: ‘Go down (all of you and live in the earth); some of you are enemies of others.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:27: (Allah) said: ‘You will spend your life in the very same earth, and will die in it, and from the same will you be brought forth (on the Day of Resurrection).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:28: O mankind! Surely, We have sent down for you (such) clothing that hides your private parts and adds (to your) aesthetic value.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:29: O mankind! (Beware!) Let not Satan put you to the test, as he ousted your parents from Paradise, stripping them of their dress so as to unveil to them their private parts.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:30: And when they commit some indecency, they say: ‘We found our ancestors on the same (way) and Allah has enjoined the same upon us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:32: He guided one group, but error was proved against the other (consequent on their own doings).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:33: O Children of Adam! Dress up decently every time you offer Prayer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:34: Say: Who has forbidden the adornment (and beautification) of Allah that He has produced for His servants and (who has also forbidden) the pure and clean food?’ Say: ‘(All these bounties) that are (available generally) for the believers in the life of this world will be exclusively (for them) on the Day of Resurrection.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:35: Say: ‘My Lord has declared unlawful only (all) the indecent acts which become known and which remain hidden, and sins and unjust excesses, and that you associate with Allah that for which He has not sent down any authority, and (in addition) saying such things about (the Essence of) Allah that you do not know yourselves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:36: And a term (has been appointed) for every people, and when their (fixed) hour approaches, they can neither hold back nor advance (even) for a single moment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:37: O Children of Adam! If Messengers come to you from amongst yourselves who relate to you My Revelations, then whoever becomes Godfearing and pious and amends (himself), neither will any fear obsess them, nor will they grieve.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:38: But those who belie Our Revelations and turn away from (believing in) them in defiance, it is they who are the inmates of Hell, its permanent residents.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:39: Then who can be a greater wrongdoer than the one who fabricates a lie against Allah or rejects His Revelations as false? The share of such people will reach them as has been written in the Book until, when the (angels) whom We send will come to them to take away their souls, they will say (to them): ‘Now where are those (false gods) whom you used to worship besides Allah?’ They will say (replying): ‘They are lost from us (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:40: Allah will say: ‘Enter the Fire, joining those (Hellish) groups of jinn and men who have passed before you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:41: And their predecessors will say to their successors: ‘You have not gained any superiority over us, so you (too) taste the torment (now) for what you used to earn.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:42: Indeed, those who reject Our Revelations as false and rebel against them, the gates of the heavens (of mercy and acceptance) shall not be opened to them, nor will they be able to enter Paradise until the camel passes through the eye of a needle (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:43: The (Fire of) Hell will be their mattress as well as a covering over them, and We torment the wrongdoers the same way.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:44: But those who believe and do good works persistently, We do not burden anyone beyond his endurance; it is they who are the people of Paradise; they will live in it forever.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:45: And We shall remove from their breasts (rancour and) spite (that they had for others in the world).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:46: And the people of Paradise will call out to the inmates of Hell: ‘We have really found true the promise that our Lord made to us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:47: (It is they) who used to hinder (the people) from the path of Allah and look for crookedness in it and they disbelieved in the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:48: And between both (of them, the inmates of Paradise and Hell) there is a barrier (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:49: And when their eyes will be turned towards the inmates of Hell, they will say: ‘O our Lord, (join) us not (together) with the unjust people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:50: And the people of the A‘raf (the Heights) will call out to those people (of Hell) whom they will be recognizing by their identification marks saying (to them): ‘Your parties could not be of any use to you, nor (could rescue you) your arrogance you used to practise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:51: Is it they about whom you used to swear (on seeing their miserable plight): Allah will (never) bless them with His mercy? (But listen! It is they who are now being called:) Enter Paradise; you will neither fear nor grieve.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:52: And the inmates of Hell will call out to the inhabitants of Paradise: ‘Bless us with some water (of Paradise), or of (the provision) that Allah has granted you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:53: Those that made their din (religion) a funfair and sport and whom the worldly life had deceived.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:54: And surely, We have brought them such a Book (the Qur’an) that We have elucidated on (the basis of Our) knowledge, a guidance and a mercy for those who believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:55: They are just waiting for the outcome of that (stated matter).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:56: Indeed, Allah is your Lord, Who created the heavens and the earth in six aeons (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:57: Invoke your Lord (both) most submissively and queitly.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:58: And do not cause disruption and mischief in the land after it has been set in order (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:59: And He is the One Who sends the winds as glad tidings before His mercy (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:60: And the soil which is productive (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:61: Indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:62: The chiefs and the affluent of his people said: ‘(O Nuh ,)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:63: surely, we find you (caught) in an open error.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:64: He said: ‘O my people, there is not any error in me, but (the truth is that) I am (raised as) a Messenger by the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:65: I communicate to you the messages of my Lord and exhort you, and I know from Allah that which you do not know.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:66: Do you wonder that direction and guidance from your Lord has come (on the tongue) of a man from amongst yourselves so that he may warn you (of the chastisement of Allah), and that you become Godfearing, and the purpose is that mercy may be shown to you?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:68: And to (the people of) ‘Ad We (sent) their (kinship) brother Hud.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:69: The chiefs and the affluent of his people who disbelieved (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:70: He said: ‘O my people, there is no foolishness about me, but (the truth is that) I am (raised as) a Messenger from the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:71: I am communicating to you the messages of my Lord and I am your trustworthy well-wisher.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:72: Do you wonder that direction and guidance from your Lord has come (on the tongue) of a man from amongst yourselves so that he may warn you (of the chastisement of Allah)? And call to mind when He made you the successors (in the land) after the people of Nuh (Noah) and in raising you amply augmented your power (might and stature).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:73: They said: ‘Have you come to us (that) we may worship only One God, Allah, and forsake (all those gods) whom our ancestors used to worship? So bring upon us that (torment) you have warned us of, if you are of the truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:74: He said: ‘Certainly, the torment and wrath upon you from your Lord has become inevitable.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:75: Then We emancipated him and those who were on his side by Our Mercy, and cut the roots of those who denied Our Revelations.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:76: And to (the people of) Thamud We (sent) their (kinship) brother Salih.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:77: And remember when He made you successors (in the land) after (the people of) ‘Ad and granted you settlement in the land.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:78: The arrogant and rebellious chiefs and the rich of his people asked the poor and the downtrodden who had accepted faith: ‘Are you sure that Salih has been really sent from his Lord (as His Messenger)?’ They said: ‘We surely believe in whatever he has been sent with.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:79: The arrogant said: ‘No doubt we strongly deny (that) which you have believed in.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:80: So they killed the she-camel (by hamstringing) and rebelled against the command of their Lord and said: ‘O Salih! Bring upon us that (torment) you have threatened us with if you are (truly) from amongst the Messengers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:81: So (the torment of) a high-scale earthquake seized them, and, in the morning, they lay (dead) in their homes with faces down upon the ground.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:82: Then (Salih) turned away from them, saying: ‘O my people, verily I delivered the message of my Lord to you and gave you advice (as well) but you do not like the counsellors.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:84: as well) when he said to his people: ‘Do you perpetrate (such) lasciviousness as no people in the world have attempted before you?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:85: Verily, you go after men for your lust, leaving the women; you are in truth given to transgression.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:86: And his people had no reply except that they said: ‘Drive them out of the town; indeed, they seek the utmost purity!’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:88: and his family, except his wife; she was one of those who stayed on in torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:90: And towards Madyan (We sent) their (kinship) brother Shu‘ayb.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:91: And do not sit on every path to frighten everyone who has embraced faith in this (call) and to hinder (him) from the path of Allah and to look for any crookedness in this (Message to make him feel frustrated and disgusted with the true Din ).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:92: And remember (Allah’s favour) when you were small in number and He multiplied you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:93: And if a party amongst you have believed in that (Din )
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:94: which I have been sent with, and some other party have not believed in it, then, (O believers,) have patience till Allah judges between us, and He is the Best of judges.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:95: The rebellious and arrogant chiefs and the affluent of his people said: ‘O Shu‘ayb, we shall in any case drive you out of our town and those who, in your company, have embraced faith, or else you shall have to return to our religion.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:96: Indeed, we would invent a lie against Allah if we returned to your religion after Allah has saved us from it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:97: And the chiefs and the affluent of his people, who had disbelieved (and denied the truth), said: ‘O people, if you follow Shu‘ayb, then you will surely be the losers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:98: Then a (torment of) high-scale earthquake seized them, and in the morning, they were dead, lying prone in their homes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:99: Those who belied Shu‘ayb were (annihilated) as if they had (never) lived in that (town).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:100: Then (Shu‘ayb) separated from them and said: ‘O my people, verily, I communicated to you the Messages of my Lord and I admonished you (as well).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:101: And never did We send a Messenger to any land but that We seized its inhabitants with hardship, scarcity, adversity and suffering (due to belying and defying the Messenger) so that they might humble themselves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:102: We then changed (their) misfortune with good fortune till they made (an all-embracing) progress.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:103: But if the inhabitants of (these) towns had embraced faith and adopted Godwariness, We would have opened to them blessings from the heaven and the earth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:104: Have the residents of the towns now become free of this fear that Our torment may seize them (again) at night when they are (fast) asleep (in carefree slumber)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:105: Or are the residents of the towns free of this fear that Our torment may seize them (again) in the forenoon when they are at play (completely lost in the worldly pleasures)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:106: Are they fearless of Allah’s secret plan? So, no one feels fearless against the secret plan of Allah except the people who run into loss.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:107: Does (this also) not guide and (enlighten) those who have inherited the earth (themselves) after (the destruction of) those (one time) dwelling in the earth that if We desire, We may punish them (as well) for their sins, and We shall seal their hearts (due to their evil behaviour), so they will be unable to hear (and understand the truth)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:108: These are the towns whose news We are narrating to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:109: And We did not find (the fulfilment of) commitment in most of them, and We found most of them but disobedient.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:110: Then after them, We sent Musa (Moses) with Our signs to Pharaoh and the nobles of his (court), but they did injustice to (these proofs and miracles).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:111: And Musa (Moses) said: ‘O Pharaoh! Indeed, I am (raised as) a Messenger from the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:112: What behooves me is to say (nothing) about Allah but the truth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:113: He (Pharaoh) said: ‘If you have brought a sign, then bring it (to the fore) if you are truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:114: So Musa (Moses) put his staff (down), and at once it changed into a veritable serpent.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:115: And he drew out his hand (after putting it into his collar opening), and that (too) at once became (radiant) white to the viewers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:116: The chiefs of Pharaoh’s people said: ‘He is undoubtedly an expert magician.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:117: (O people!) He seeks to drive you out of your land.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:118: They said: ‘Put (the matter) of Musa (Moses) and his brother off (for a while), and send out heralds to (different) cities to summon (magicians).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:119: They will bring you every skilful sorcerer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:120: And the magicians came to Pharaoh and said: ‘There should certainly be some reward for us if we overmaster.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:121: Pharaoh said: ‘Yes, of course; (what to talk of a simple reward! In that case) you will be amongst the privileged ones (of my court).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:122: (The magicians) said: ‘Musa (Moses)! Either you throw (your object) or we become (the first) to throw.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:124: And We revealed to Musa (Moses): ‘(Now) throw your staff (on the ground).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:125: So, the truth was established, and everything that they had been doing was proved false.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:126: So, they (the representatives of Pharaoh) were vanquished on the spot and backed away humiliated.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:127: And (all) the sorcerers fell down prostrate.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:128: They exclaimed: ‘We believe in the (real) Sustainer of all the worlds,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 7:130: Pharaoh said: ‘(Have) you believed in Him even before I permitted you? This is indeed a plot which you (all) have hatched (against me) in this city in order that you may expatriate from this (country) its (Coptic) inhabitants.

null.verse 7:48: Ja rajamuurilla seisovat huutavat niille, jotka he tuntevat tunnusmerkeistä, sanoen: »Mitä hyötyä teille nyt tuli paljoudestanne ja ylpeilystänne?
null.verse 7:49: Näitäkö tarkoitatte vannoessanne, ettei Jumala heille armoaan osoita?» (ja toisille he sanovat:) »Astukaa sisään paratiisiin, ei pelko eikä murhe vaivaa teitä.
null.verse 7:50: Ja tulen asukkaat huutavat silloin paratiisin asukkaille: »Vuodattakaa ylitsemme vähän vettä tai jotakin muuta, mitä Jumala on suonut teille!» Nämä vastaavat: »Jumala on totisesti kieltänyt sen uskottomilta,
null.verse 7:51: niiltä, jotka pitivät uskontoaan leikkinä ja turhuutena ja joita maallinen elämä vietteli.
null.verse 7:52: Olemmehan lähettänyt heille Pyhän Kirjoituksen, jonka olemme selittänyt johdatukseksi ja armonosoitukseksi ihmisille, jotka uskovat.
null.verse 7:53: Odottavatko he jotakin muuta kuin sen täyttymystä? Sinä päivänä, jolloin se täyttyy, sanovat ne, jotka ennen olivat sen hylänneet: »Totisesti olivat ne Herramme lähettiläitä, jotka toivat luoksemme totuuden.
null.verse 7:54: Teidän Herranne on totisesti Jumala, joka on luonut taivaat ja maan kuudessa päivässä ja noussut sitten valtaistuimelleen.
null.verse 7:55: Rukoilkaa Herraanne nöyryydessä ja hiljaisuudessa.
null.verse 7:56: Älkää aikaansaako turmelusta maan päällä senjälkeen, kun kaikki on saatettu järjestykseen, vaan rukoilkaa Häntä peläten ja kaivaten.
null.verse 7:57: Hän se lähettää tuulet armonsa sanansaattajiksi, niin että ne ottavat kantaakseen raskaita pilviä, joita Me ajamme autioituneeseen seutuun ja sen yli vuodatamme niistä vettä, jonka avulla kasvatamme kaikenlaisia hedelmiä.
null.verse 7:58: Hyvä maaperä antaa sadon Herransa käskystä, mutta huono ei anna kuin kurjuutta.
null.verse 7:59: Totisesti lähetimme jo Nooan kansansa luo, ja hän sanoi: »Kansani, palvelkaa Jumalaa; teillä ei ole muuta jumalaa kuin Hän, minä pelkään, että rangaistus lankeaa ylitsenne sinä suurena päivänä.
null.verse 7:60: Hänen kansansa päälliköt vastasivat: »Me näemme tosiaankin, että olet ilmeisesti harhassa.
null.verse 7:61: Silloin sanoi hän: »Kansani, en ole harhassa, vaan olen koko maailman Herran lähettiläs.
null.verse 7:62: Olen tuomassa teille Herrani sanomaa; neuvon teitä omaksi parhaaksenne, ja Jumalalta olen saanut tietää, mitä te ette tiedä.
null.verse 7:63: Sitäkö ihmettelette, että mies omasta keskuudestanne tuo teille Herraltanne muistutuksen, varoittaakseen teitä, jotta harjoittaisitte hartautta ja ehkä saisitte armon osaksenne?»
null.verse 7:64: Mutta he pitivät häntä valehtelijana, ja niin pelastimme Me hänet ja hänen seuralaisensa arkkiin ja hukutimme veteen ne, jotka väittivät tunnusmerkkimme valheeksi; he olivat totisesti sokaistuja ihmisiä.
null.verse 7:65: Sitten lähetimme Aadin (kansan) luo heidän veljensä Huudin .
null.verse 7:66: Hänen kansansa uskottomien johtajat vastasivat: »Näemme totisesti, että sinä olet mieletön, ja pidämme sinua valehtelijana.
null.verse 7:67: Silloin sanoi hän: »Kansani, minä en ole mieletön, vaan olen koko maailman Herran lähettiläs.
null.verse 7:68: Olen tuomassa teille Herrani sanomaa; tahdon teidän parastanne ja olen luotettava neuvojanne.
null.verse 7:69: Ihmettelette ehkä sitä, että mies omasta keskuudestanne on saanut luodakseen muistutuksen Herraltanne varoittaakseen teitä.
null.verse 7:70: He vastasivat: »Oletko tullut luoksemme, jotta me palvelisimme yksinomaan Jumalaa ja hylkäisimme ne, joita meidän esi-isämme palvelivat? Jos niin on, osoita meille sitten kaikki, minkä lupaat meille, jos olet totuudessa.
null.verse 7:71: Hän sanoi: »Teitä tulee kohtaamaan onnettomuus ja Herranne kiivaus.
null.verse 7:72: Ja niin pelastimme Me armossamme hänet ja ne, jotka seurasivat häntä, ja hävitimme juurineen ne, jotka vääristelivät tunnusmerkkimme eivätkä uskoneet.
null.verse 7:73: Niin lähetimme Me Tamuudin luo heidän veljensä Saalihin.
null.verse 7:74: Muistakaa, kuinka Hän teki teidät Aadin seuraajaksi ja antoi teille turvapaikan maan päällä, rakentaaksenne itsellenne linnoja sen tasangoilla ja hakataksenne vuoriin asuntoja.
null.verse 7:75: Silloin sanoivat hänen kansansa ylpeät päälliköt niille, joita pidettiin liian heikkoina, - niille heistä, jotka olivat tulleet uskoon: »Tiedättekö, onko Saalih Herransa lähettiläs?» He vastasivat: »Me uskomme totisesti siihen sanomaan, jota hänet on lähetetty tuomaan.
null.verse 7:76: Silloin sanoivat ylpeät: »Me emme totisesti usko siihen, mihin te uskotte.
null.verse 7:77: Niin silpoivat he naaraskamelin ja rikkoivat Herransa käskyn ja sanoivat: »Saalih, tee meille mitä uhkaat, jos olet lähettiläs.
null.verse 7:78: Ja niin yllätti maanjäristys heidät, ja seuraavana aamuna makasivat he kuolleina kodeissaan.
null.verse 7:79: Ja hän kääntyi pois heistä ja sanoi: »Kansani, olen totisesti esittänyt Herrani sanoman teille, ja neuvonut teitä parhaaksenne, mutta te ette rakasta neuvojia.
null.verse 7:80: Ja Loot oli Meidän lähettiläämme, kun hän puhui kansalleen: »Harjoitatteko irstaisuutta, jota kukaan koko maailmassa ei ole tehnyt ennen teitä?
null.verse 7:81: Totisesti ryhdytte himossanne miehiin mieluummin kuin naisiin.
null.verse 7:82: Ja hänen kansansa vastaus ei ollut parempi kuin: »Ajakaa heidät pois kaupungistanne, sillä he ovat niitä ihmisiä, jotka harjoittavat puhtautta.
null.verse 7:83: Silloin pelastimme Me hänet ja hänen sukunsa paitsi hänen vaimoaan, joka jäi jälkeen.
null.verse 7:84: Ja Me annoimme sateen peittää ne toiset, katso minkä lopun väärintekijät saivat!
null.verse 7:85: Ja Midianin kansan luo (lähetimme Me) heidän veljensä Soeibin.
null.verse 7:86: Älkääkä väijykö kaikilla mahdollisilla teillä, uhaten ja kääntäen pois Jumalan tieltä niitä, jotka uskovat Häneen, älkääkä pyrkikö sitä tekemään mutkaiseksi! Ja muistakaa, että ollessanne vähälukuisia Hän enensi teidän joukkonne, ja katsokaa, minkä lopun saivat väärintekijät.
null.verse 7:87: Jos toiset teistä uskovat siihen sanomaan, jota tuomaan minut lähetettiin, ja toiset eivät usko, niin odottakaa kärsivällisesti, kunnes Jumala ratkaisee asianne; sillä Hän on paras tuomari.
null.verse 7:88: Ylpeiden johtomiehet hänen kansansa keskuudessa sanoivat: »Me ajamme totisesti pois kaupungistamme sekä sinut Soeib että ne, jotka sinun tavallasi uskovat, tai sitten palaatte meidän uskontoomme.
null.verse 7:89: Sepittäisimmehän siten valheen Jumalasta, jos palaisimme teidän uskontoonne Jumalan pelastettua meidät siitä.
null.verse 7:90: Ja uskottomien johtomiehet hänen kansansa keskuudessa sanoivat: »Totisesti, jos seuraatte Soeibia, olette kadotuksen omia.
null.verse 7:91: Silloin yllätti maanjäristys heidät, ja seuraavana aamuna makasivat he kuolleina olinpaikoissaan.
null.verse 7:92: Ikäänkuin niitä, jotka väittivät Soeihia valehtelijaksi, ei koskaan olisi ollutkaan; ne, jotka pitivät Soeibia valehtelijana, perivät häviön.
null.verse 7:93: Ja hän kääntyi pois heistä ja sanoi: »Kansani, olenhan saattanut teille Herrani sanoman ja neuvonut teitä hyvään; miksi kantaisin murhetta epäuskoisten ihmisten takia?»
null.verse 7:94: Emme Me koskaan ole lähettänyt ketään profeettaa mihinkään kaupunkiin koettelematta sen asukkaita surulla ja vastoinkäymisellä, jotta he nöyrtyisivät.
null.verse 7:95: Senjälkeen Me vaihdoimme pahan hyvään, niin että he paisuivat ja sanoivat: »Niinhän esi~isäimmekin elämä kulki surusta iloon.
null.verse 7:96: Mutta jos kaupunkien asukkaat olisivat pysyneet uskossa ja jumalanpelossa, olisimme Me totisesti siunanneet heitä runsaasti sekä taivaasta että maasta käsin; mutta he punoivat valhetta, ja silloin Me yllätimme heidät ansionsa mukaan.
null.verse 7:97: Ovatko kaupunkien asukkaat varmat siitä, ettei Meidän voimamme heidän ylitsensä lankea yön aikaan heidän nukkuessaan?
null.verse 7:98: Ovatko kaupunkien asukkaat turvassa Meidän voimaltamme valoisan päivän aikaan huvitellessaan?
